name: PreAward Grants Consultant (Open Rank)
description:
* Applications are accepted electronically ONLY at www.cu.edu/cu-careers.*

University of Colorado Denver l Anschutz Medical Campus

School of Medicine | Dean's Office, PreAward Core

PreAward Grants Consultant (Open Rank)

Position #1962 Requisition 14116

The Dean's Office, PreAward Core has an opening for a full-time, University Staff (unclassified) PreAward Grants Consultant (Open Rank) position.

The University of Colorado Anschutz Medical Campus ranks among the top institutions nationally in clinical care, education and research. Its 230-acre campus, designed to enhance collaboration and interprofessional education, hosts the College of Nursing; the Schools of Dental Medicine, Medicine, Pharmacy, and Public Health; the Graduate School; a Health Sciences Library; and two hospitals. Strategically located contiguous to the campus are a biosciences research park and the soon-to-be-completed Veterans Hospital. CU Anschutz offers two undergraduate degrees, 35 graduate degrees, and five first-professional programs. More than 4,000 students learn alongside faculty members who also make meaningful medical discoveries and provide expert clinical care through 1.5 million patient-visits annually. A hub for research and innovation, CU Anschutz receives over $400 million in research awards each year and has filed 1,300 patent applications and formed 53 new companies since 2002. Read CU Anschutz Quick Facts here.

Job Summary:

Jobs in this career family provide direct professional support of research activities. Functions include contracts and grants solicitation and administration, grant/agreement preparation, review and negotiation, regulatory compliance, sponsor communication and post and pre award management, human subject compliance, research animal management, research laboratory coordination and instruction, environmental health and safety, radiation control, hazardous materials use, disposal and training.

Entry Level:

Professionals at the entry level are responsible for exercising discretion, analytical skill, personal accountability and responsibility in a wide range of areas including academic, administrative, managerial and student services functions. Work involves creating, integrating, applying and sharing knowledge directly related to a professional field. These positions may be filled at the entry through senior level, depending on the successful candidate's education, experience and suitability for these particular positions.

At the entry level, duties are limited in scope and are performed with guidance and direction from other professionals and are performed in a training and Development capacity.

Intermediate Level:

Professionals at the intermediate level are responsible for exercising discretion, analytical skill, personal accountability and responsibility in a wide range of areas including academic, administrative, managerial and student services functions. Work involves creating, integrating, applying and sharing knowledge directly related to a professional field.

At the intermediate level, duties may be more limited in scope and are performed with guidance and direction from other professionals.

Senior Level:

Senior Professionals are responsible for exercising discretion, analytical skill, personal accountability and responsibility in a wide range of areas including academic, administrative, managerial and student services functions. Work involves creating, integrating, applying and sharing knowledge directly related to a professional field. Work is performed fully independently.

Examples of Work Performed:

The major function of this position is to assist faculty in submission and preaward administration of grants and contracts. This position will be responsible for the management, development, implementation and oversight of preaward grant functions, including ensuring all applications follow the sponsor guidelines, the University guidelines and timelines, and adhere to all grant application regulations and requirements. This position may be filled at the entry through the senior professional level, depending on the successful candidate's education, experience, and suitability for the position.

This description is a summary only and is describing the general level of work being performed, it is not intended to be all-inclusive. The duties of this position may change from time to time and/or based on business need. We reserve the right to add or delete duties and responsibilities at the discretion of the supervisor and/or hiring authority.

PLEASE NOTE: Candidates will be responsible for travel expenses related to the interview process and any relocation expenses, if applicable.

Salary and Benefits:

The hiring salary for this position has been established at $43,266 - $85,513 and is commensurate with skills and experience. This position is not eligible for overtime compensation.

The University of Colorado offers a full benefits package. Information on University benefits programs, including eligibility, is located at https://www.jobsatcu.com/hr/postings/true.

The University of Colorado Denver | Anschutz Medical Campus is dedicated to ensuring a safe and secure environment for our faculty, staff, students and visitors. To assist in achieving that goal, we conduct background investigations for all prospective employees.

The University of Colorado Denver | Anschutz Medical Campus is committed to recruiting and supporting a diverse student body, faculty and administrative staff. The university strives to promote a culture of inclusiveness, respect, communication and understanding. We encourage applications from women, ethnic minorities, persons with disabilities and all veterans. The University of Colorado is committed to diversity and equality in education and employment.

Minimum Qualifications:

For Entry-Level Appointments

* A bachelor's degree in finance, accounting, business administration, business, public health, public administration, or a directly related field from an accredited institution.

Substitution: A combination of education and related technical/paraprofessional experience may be substituted for the bachelor's degree on a year for year basis.

For Intermediate-Level Appointments:

* A bachelor's degree in finance, accounting, business administration, business, public health, public administration, or a directly related field from an accredited institution and 1 year of professional grant or contract experience.

Substitution: A combination of education and related technical/paraprofessional experience may be substituted for the bachelor's degree on a year for year basis, but not for the specific experience.

For Senior-Level Appointments

* A bachelor's degree in finance, accounting, business administration, business, public health, public administration, or a directly related field from an accredited institution and 2 years of professional grant or contract experience.

Substitution: A combination of education and related technical/paraprofessional experience may be substituted for the bachelor's degree on a year for year basis, but not for the specific experience.

Preferred Qualifications:

* Experience working with Info Ed Proposal Development System or similar grant submission software.

* Experience working in an academic environment or medical center.

* Experience working with PeopleSoft (HRMS &/or Finance).

* Previous grant and/or contract experience.

* Previous research administration experience

Competencies/Knowledge, Skills & Abilities:

* Ability to communicate effectively, both in writing and orally.

* Ability to establish and maintain effective working relationships with employees at all levels throughout the institution.

* Outstanding customer service skills.

* Demonstrated commitment and leadership ability to advance diversity and inclusion.

* Ability to prioritize and handle multiple competing deadlines in a fast-paced environment.

* Ability to maintain high level of confidentiality with sensitive information.

Diversity and Equity:

description:
Job Description
Company: LEAP Software

Job Title: Product Consultant

Location: Jersey City

Salary: $50,000 ($110,000 OTE)

REF: J1138:NJ

Sector: IT Services

LEAP Software really invests their time and money in their employees. Industry leading training, equipment and mentoring creates the perfect platform for college graduates to excel in their career. If you’ve got a proven track record of success in a sales environment, or if you’re looking for a change of career as an intelligent professional, we want to hear from you!

So what do LEAP Software do?

LEAP are an innovative organization that provides small law firms across the globe with case management solutions to streamline the ways in which they do business. With over 300 employees, 12,000 clients and offices across the USA, Australia and the UK, they have the tools and stature necessary to catalyse your career! Not only do they offer you excellent professional support, the material package they offer is comprehensive and attractive. Six figure earning potential, a company car, cell, laptop, healthcare, company vacations, gym membership…there is hardly advertising space to detail the benefits available to the successful candidate!

The Role: Graduate Sales Representative / Product Consultant

Following on from LEAP’s extensive training an induction programme, you’ll have the opportunity to perform in a fast-paced, target driven environment. The successful candidate will uncover new business, they will relish interacting and negotiating with key decision makers and professionals at all levels. As well as strategically generating new business leads, you’ll undertake a variety of exciting duties.

You will develop rapport and book demonstrations with clients over the phone, before demonstrating the value of LEAP’s offering to clients both online and on site. In this role you assume responsibility for the entire sales cycle – from initial contact, through to negotiation and closing business deals. The Graduate Sales Representative will enjoy interacting with people – you’ll have the opportunity to network with key clients at conferences and events!

LEAP requires ambitious college graduates, those with sales experience or those from a legal background. If you fit this profile, possess the requisite self-motivation, ambition and confidence, then apply today!

The Role (Not exhaustive):

· Strategically identify and call new business leads, constantly mindful of how to promote LEAP’s proposition

· Alleviate and clarify client concerns over LEAP’s product offering

· Book product demonstrations with clients

· Deliver demonstrations, proposals and exemplify LEAP’s key benefits online and to client’s on site

· Maintain knowledge of LEAP’s products and competitors in order to help champion their status at the top of their field

· Negotiate and close business with key decision makers to meet and exceed your targets

Benefits/What you get:

· A very competitive basic salary of $50,000

· Y1 OTE of $110,000

· A cell phone

· A laptop

· Gym Membership

· Healthcare

· Company Vacations

· A vibrant, exciting culture that includes regular socials!

· Lucrative bonus/incentive schemes

You:

· A college graduate with full Bachelor’s degree

· Full driving licence

· Past experience in sales and/or a legal background, such as a Paralegal or solicitor

· Excellent communication/relationship building skills

· Ambitious and drive

name: Senior Associate Consultant, Embedded Analytics
description:
Company Description

Leading Products Innovative Ideas Exceptional People .MicroStrategy, A Dynamic Place to Work!

At MicroStrategy, we are passionate about creating powerful, disruptive technologies that transform how companies do business. Innovative products and ultimately our success are rooted in one driving forceour people. Our casual and flexible environment encourages creativity and collaboration, so you'll have the opportunity to initiate and contribute to challenging projects, while pursuing your interests and developing, both professionally and personally. Bring us your passion, curiosity, and fresh ideas, and be a part of technology innovation at its best!

Job Description

The Role: The Embedded Analytics Practice, part of MicroStrategy Professional Services, consists of a team of experienced professionals that give structure to the way the company approaches services opportunities regarding the Embedded Analytics product. This team is in charge of estimating, scoping, managing, and delivering Embedded Analytics engagements. It also provides advisory services and technical oversight and gives feedback to designs approaches and effort estimations. MicroStrategy Consultants empower customers to make more informed decisions by providing timely, relevant, and accurate answers to their business questions. To achieve this mission, Consultants work to understand business needs and technical requirements, and design and implement high value solutions in the MicroStrategy platform and in the Embedded Analytics domain. MicroStrategy Consultants are an integral part of the world's largest staff of MicroStrategy Certified Engineers and leverage knowledge and best practices across our global team for customer success. MicroStrategy Professional Services' Career Path provides growth opportunities at all levels within the organization.

The Senior Associate Consultant position is an entry level position focusing on the rapid acquisition and application of new knowledge through a variety of customer project assignments. Delivers billable consulting services. Efforts may be directed toward various MicroStrategy and / or supporting products and services
Ensures a solid understanding of business objectives associated with projects and/or programs to which he or she is assigned

Works within an internal sphere of influence typically bounded by project or regional activities
Supports the team taking ideas from concept through full deployment
Develops an awareness of the competitive landscape including key differentiators and competitive positioning
Qualifications

Motivation, Innovation, Passion, Integrity, Teamwork, Customer-Focus.

You should also bring the following:
Bachelors or equivalent degree in a business, technical, or related field
Up to 2 years of related experience
Commitment to personal and professional growth
Demonstrated ability to learn new technologies and business requirements
Programming or systems development experience preferred
Effective oral and written communication skills
Ability to work effectively independently as well as in a team environment
Staffing to local projects wherever possible, however field consultants can expect periods a

name: Business Intelligence & Analytics Consultant - Entry Level Opportunities
description:
Thorogood is an independent, specialized consulting firm that works with some of the biggest and best-known companies around the world. We work with managers at all levels to help them understand their business goals in the context of the technical possibilities and to design and develop business intelligence and analytics solutions. We compete on the basis of our specialism, our people, high quality and assured delivery.

Our consultants are expected to have a strong interest in business, and excellent listening, writing and presenting skills as well as the aptitude and motivation to master multiple technologies in a fast-moving field. We work in combination with customers and colleagues (in the US, UK, India, Singapore, and Brazil) to provide effective solutions. The ability to work collaboratively and effectively as part of a distributed team is a pre-requisite.

Our most successful consultants develop a well-rounded set of skills around consulting and people management, business understanding and technology. You’ll do so through
Comprehensive training: (depending on prior experience) You will start with our training program, in which experienced consultants will introduce you to the technologies we work with, the industries we serve and the way we develop our business. Crucially, we will share how we live our values. When you’ve finished, we’ll plan to have you working on a client project immediately.
Building your core technology skills: We’re the kind of people who learn best by doing. You’ll be working on a team locked onto business value for the customer to develop fast, effective and high quality technical solutions.
Working with top clients - some of the biggest and best-known companies in the world: You’ll be a part of client interactions, sometimes leading them, to make sure we’re keeping our projects on track and our clients happy.
Developing relationships: We consider ourselves trusted advisors for our clients. We earn this trust through open communication and by delivering valued solutions.
Working as part of a supportive project team: You’ll be working either from our office or travelling externally to the client's site. Your project team will be a mix of experienced and more junior consultants working together daily to support one another along the way.
Become an expert yourself: Our experts are not necessarily the most tenured people at Thorogood. In the rapidly changing world of Business Intelligence and Analytics, we look to all levels of experience for our expertise in new technologies.
In addition to client work, Thorogood consultants run our company. We expect you’ll be contributing here, too.
Helping to grow your own value and our business: Interact with clients, listen to their needs and assist in business development meetings and demonstrations to help them understand their business goals in the context of what’s technically possible.
Get involved with our educationally-focused marketing events: Prepare and deliver informational events for prospective clients.
Helping to develop our consultancy: Contributing to recruiting, training and managing.
We hand select each of our consultants very carefully, and we place a great deal of value on their growth and happiness. In addition to a challenging and rewarding career path, Thorogood offers the following benefits:
Company sponsored health coverage
401k program with employer match
Generous vacation allowance
Incentive programs
Opportunities to travel
Focus on work-life balance
This position is based in our Center City, Philadelphia office for a start date in early 2019.

Our US company is actively expanding to the New England area. Successful candidates interested in joining our new Boston office will start their Thorogood career in our Center City, Philadelphia office in early 2019 for a one-year rotational period. Consultants will locate to the Boston area in early 2020.

Desired Skills and Experience

As a growing organization, we are constantly looking for people who are interested in business, technology and data driven decision making to join our consulting teams.

Qualified candidates must have:
Solid academic record in a related discipline, particularly engineering, computer science, mathematics, business or management.
1-3 years of work experience. Previous experience working in BI, analytics or data science, or in one or more of our target industries of consumer packaged goods, financial services, pharmaceuticals and insurance is welcome but not required.
Candidates must demonstrate effectiveness with:
Working individually or as part of project teams
Responsibility and accountability for quality and work delivery
Client focus and relationship management
Time management and priority setting
Data awareness and business interest
Learning new technology
Successful candidates will be capable of and motivated by working across the entire project lifecycle as part of a globally distributed team, demonstrating strong interpersonal communications and relationship management skills. They will have the motivation to take on new responsibilities.

Please highlight any experience you have with:
Cloud BI & Analytics technologies: AWS, Microsoft Azure, etc.
R, Python or other software for statistical analysis
Microsoft BI – SQL Server, Integration Services (SSIS), Analysis Services (SSAS), Reporting Services (SSRS), Power BI, Cortana Intelligence Suite
Anaplan
Tableau
Amazon Redshift
QlikView
Teradata
SharePoint
SAP BO/WEBI
**Please include a cover letter with your resume for consideration and specify desired office location (Philadelphia, Boston).**

Please note: Thorogood will ensure that every employee is authorized to work in the United States. If you are offered employment with the Company, we shall require proof of your authorization to work within the United States. Thorogood does not sponsor applicants for work visas. Applicants must be currently authorized to work within the United States on a full-time basis.

name: Consulting Utility Forester/ Transmission Work Planner
description:
Requisition Number: 34070
Company Name: DRG Inc 
Service Line: 1UVM - DRG Utility Vegetation Management 
Employment Type: Regular 
Job Type: Full Time 
Education Level Required: Bachelors 
Work Experience Required: 1 - 2 years 
Travel Expectations: Up to 25% 

 

 

Position: Consulting Utility Forester/ Transmission Work Planner – Ashland & Pikeville, KY

Starting Date: Immediately. Applications accepted until suitable candidate is selected. Location: Eastern Kentucky

 

Looking for a great opportunity to grow in a dynamic industry? Want to join highly skilled teams with diverse backgrounds? Join our Foresters, Horticulturalists, Plant Scientists, Ecologists, GIS and Natural Resource Specialists within the Davey Resource Group, Inc.! Become part of our energetic workforce, build your career, and emerge as a leader in the green industry! Spend your days outdoors and enjoy an engaging work environment where we apply technology, communication, and teamwork to help bridge the gap between human progress and the natural world.

Get your hands and boots dirty while educating the public on the response growth of trees. Make an impact on a community for a utility enhancement project. Davey Resource Group, Inc. a 100% employee owned company. Our opportunities are for the adventurous and passionate!

 

What you’ll do:
Successfully contribute to all aspects of vegetation management planning and analysis.
Utilize innovative technology and practices to help major electric utility providers deliver safe and reliable power.
Inspect and assess vegetation in right-of-ways for compliance standards and construction work plans.
Identify tree and brush control work and protection zone recommendations.
Collect data and document work using hand-held computers; assess terrain, habitat, and environmental conditions, and support IVM projects.
Coordinate with Project Managers, Planners, and Vegetation Crews to create customized solutions.
 

What you’ll need:
Ability to work and hike in rugged terrain and inclement weather; ability to read and follow GIS data and maps; ability to work independently.
Leadership experience and a desire for career growth will be given a priority.
Demonstrated expertise in problem solving and technical innovation.
Excellent communication and interpersonal skills.
Availability and desire to travel throughout the utility service area.
Clean DMV driving record and ability to drive and operate a 4x4 vehicle.
Two or Four year degree in Forestry, Urban Forestry, Horticulture or related discipline; ISA Utility Specialist; Qualified Applicators License (QAL), Pest Control Advisor (PCA), Registered Professional Forester (RPF), Utility Right-of-Way Vegetation experience are preferred.
Ability to identify local tree species & growth rates.
Organizational skills; working knowledge of computers and programs, file creation, manipulation and sharing.
 

What you’ll get:
 A company repeatedly recognized as a top performer.
An innovative and success driven work environment.
The opportunity to work in this country’s great outdoors.
Great teammates that will help support your professional growth.
Managers who empower and genuinely care about each team members’ success.
The resources you need to excel and grow through the Davey Institute of Tree Science.
An excuse to be enthusiastic every day.
Company vehicle for commuting purposes & cell phone.
Competitive wages & excellent benefits. Pay rates based on qualifications & experience.
Opportunity to work for and become an employee-owner with the #1 100% employee owned service company in the country.
 

If a career exploring the forest with Davey excites you, please apply at: https://bit.ly/2St34Fu or by sending your resume and cover letter to:

 

James Panezott Email: Forestry.Careers@davey.com Phone: (800) 828-8312 x8039

Subject: Consulting Utility Forester/ Transmission Work Planner – Ashland & Pikeville, KY #34070

 

Who we are:

The Davey Resource Group, Inc. is an Equal Opportunity Employer that is focused and relentless in our pursuit to help our utility clients deliver safe and reliable power to their customers and to help maintain national security. We are results driven by our great people and the technology at our fingertips. Not ordinary great people, but those who love being the best and being a part of building something extraordinary. People who want to create change, who love what they do and the people they do it with. We are currently hiring Arborists, Foresters, Horticulturalists, Natural Resource Specialists, and plant and outdoor enthusiasts. Various full time positions available include; entry level, special projects, and supervisory roles. We are seeking candidates who have positive attitudes, excellent communication skills, and critical attention to detail. Team players who have a thirst for knowledge and growth may apply. Military Veterans are also encouraged to apply.

 

Visit the Davey Careers Website: JOBS.DAVEY.COM for other job opportunities and company information.

 

 

 

The Davey Tree Expert Company has U.S. and Canadian operations in more than 47 states and five provinces and provides a variety of tree care, grounds maintenance and consulting services for the residential, utility, commercial, and government markets. Founded in 1880, Davey has been employee-owned for 35 years and has more than 8,000 employees who provide Proven Solutions for a Growing World. For more information, visit www.davey.com

If you need any assistance at any time please contact us at 1-800-445-8733 ext. 1108 or at ed.help@davey.com.

name: Bilingual Energy Consultant
description:
Entry Level Solar Marketing and Sales Representative

ABOUT OUR COMPANY

Awarded the fastest growing business in New Jersey, Trinity Solar is the largest privately-held residential solar installation contractor in the United States. You will be joining a fast-paced, dynamic organization focused on changing how the world uses energy. Founded over 20 years ago, Trinity built their company based on strong moral principles and values that have developed a culture and business into what over 1,500 proud American workers call home.

ABOUT THE OPPORTUNITY

Trinity is looking for talented people who are passionate about innovation, clean energy, and delivering the best possible service to our customers. We are seeking highly motivated and reliable candidates to join our Field Sales Divisions on a full time basis. These representatives are at the forefront of customer acquisition. You will participate in the sales process by generating leads and soliciting qualified homes for solar.

COMPENSATION

$30,000 W-2 Base Salary including paid training plus performance-based commissions and monthly bonuses.

Can make $70,000-$120,000 your first year. Top producers can earn north of $150,000.

401(k) available with employer contribution.

Benefits package including available medical, dental, vision and life insurances.

Career path opportunities in direct sales and management after one year.

RESPONSIBILITIES

Generate qualified leads of homeowners interested in residential solar energy systems

Serve as a consultant and provide useful product knowledge to qualifying homeowners

Acquire, retain and constantly develop industry knowledge

Represent Trinity Solar and its brand with professionalism and integrity

Meet and exceed lead generation goals

DESIRED EXPERIENCE AND QUALIFICATIONS

1+ years of sales, customer service and/or consulting experience

Must have excellent communication and customer service skills

Must be self-driven & highly motivated

Ability to work under pressure to meet deadlines and quotas

Must be flexible working weekend and evening hours

Ability to prioritize and multitask appropriately

Must have reliable transportation

Certain opportunities require a clean DMV record

Must be able to pass a pre-employment background check

Applicants must be 18 years old or older

Bilingual abilities are a plus

Must have cell phone with data and internet

Trinity Solar is an Equal Opportunity Employer committed to diversity in the workplace. Consistent with that goal, all qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, national origin, age, disability, protected veteran status, gender identity or any other category protected by applicable federal, state or local laws.

Customer Service: 1 year (Preferred)

Spanish (Preferred)

name: Consulting Utility Forester - Travelling Project Forester
description:
Requisition Number: 33983
Company Name: DRG Inc 
Service Line: 1UVM - DRG Utility Vegetation Management 
Employment Type: Regular 
Job Type: Full Time 
Education Level Required: Bachelors 
Work Experience Required: 1 - 2 years 
Travel Expectations: Up to 50% 

 

Position: Consulting Utility Forester - Travelling Project Forester

Location: Mid-Atlantic Region Starting Date: Immediately.

 

Looking for a great opportunity to grow in a dynamic industry? Want to join highly skilled teams with diverse backgrounds? Join our Foresters, Horticulturalists, Plant Scientists, Ecologists, GIS and Natural Resource Specialists within the Davey Resource Group, Inc.! Become part of our energetic workforce, build your career, and emerge as a leader in the green industry! Spend your days outdoors and enjoy an engaging work environment where we apply technology, communication, and teamwork to help bridge the gap between human progress and the natural world.

Get your hands and boots dirty while educating the public on the response growth of trees. Make an impact on a community for a utility enhancement project. Davey Resource Group, Inc. a 100% employee owned company. Our opportunities are for the adventurous and passionate!

 

What you’ll do:
Successfully contribute to all aspects of vegetation management planning and analysis.
Utilize innovative technology and practices to help major utility providers deliver safe and reliable power.
Inspect and assess vegetation in right-of-ways for compliance standards and construction work plans.
Identify tree and brush control work and protection zone recommendations.
Monitor and assist with forestry, road building, or reclamation activities associated with new construction.
Assist in problem analysis and development of compliance strategies with limited direct supervision or direction.
Assist in the development of and conducting of environmental compliance training.
Assist in inspecting, provides advice on operations, construction, procedures, records and training to ensure compliance with environment/agricultural requirements prescribed in laws, regulations, and company policies and procedures.
Coordinate with Project Managers, Planners, and Vegetation Crews to create customized solutions.
Perform field inspections of vegetation management work completed by contractor tree crews and post-circuit inspections of rework to assure specification compliance.
Administer required guidance, to contracted tree companies as it relates to implementing the Utility’s vegetation management specifications within an assigned territory.
Performing all duties associated with clearing vegetation for new construction (not to include physically: removing trees, mowing, or operating heavy equipment).
 

What you’ll need:
Ability to work and hike in rugged terrain and inclement weather; ability to read and follow GIS data and maps; ability to work independently.
Leadership experience and a desire for career growth will be given a priority.
Demonstrated expertise in problem solving and technical innovation.
Excellent communication and interpersonal skills.
Availability and desire to travel throughout the utility service area.
Clean DMV driving record and ability to drive and operate a 4x4 vehicle.
Two or Four year degree in Forestry, Urban Forestry, Horticulture or related discipline; ISA Utility Specialist; Qualified Applicators License (QAL), Pest Control Advisor (PCA), Registered Professional Forester (RPF), Utility Right-of-Way Vegetation experience are preferred.
Ability to identify local tree species & growth rates.
Organizational skills; working knowledge of computers and programs, file creation, manipulation and sharing.
 

What you’ll get:
 A company repeatedly recognized as a top performer.
An innovative and success driven work environment.
The opportunity to work in this country’s great outdoors.
Great teammates that will help support your professional growth.
Managers who empower and genuinely care about each team members’ success.
The resources you need to excel and grow through the Davey Institute of Tree Science.
An excuse to be enthusiastic every day.
Company vehicle for commuting purposes & cell phone.
Competitive wages & excellent benefits. Pay rates based on qualifications & experience.
Opportunity to work for and become an employee-owner with the #1 100% employee owned service company in the country.

 

Who we are:

The Davey Resource Group, Inc. is an Equal Opportunity Employer that is focused and relentless in our pursuit to help our utility clients deliver safe and reliable power to their customers and to help maintain national security. We are results driven by our great people and the technology at our fingertips. Not ordinary great people, but those who love being the best and being a part of building something extraordinary. People who want to create change, who love what they do and the people they do it with. We are currently hiring Arborists, Foresters, Horticulturalists, Natural Resource Specialists, and plant and outdoor enthusiasts. Various full-time positions available include; entry level, special projects, and supervisory roles. We are seeking candidates who have positive attitudes, excellent communication skills, and critical attention to detail. Team players who have a thirst for knowledge and growth may apply. Military Veterans are also encouraged to apply.

 

If a career exploring the forest with Davey excites you, please apply on JOBS.DAVEY.COM

 

 

 

The Davey Tree Expert Company has U.S. and Canadian operations in more than 47 states and five provinces and provides a variety of tree care, grounds maintenance and consulting services for the residential, utility, commercial, and government markets. Founded in 1880, Davey has been employee-owned for 35 years and has more than 8,000 employees who provide Proven Solutions for a Growing World. For more information, visit www.davey.com

If you need any assistance at any time please contact us at 1-800-445-8733 ext. 1108 or at ed.help@davey.com.

You can choose to work for one of the top companies in the automotive industry.

US Citizen/Green Card/EAD required
At a Glance

MHP A Porsche Company is one of the leading management and IT consultancies in particular, for the automotive industry and a subsidiary of Porsche AG (81.8%). The unique MHP approach to consulting is based on the symbiosis of management and IT consulting services. MHP, as a process supplier, optimizes and digitizes customer processes throughout the value chain with its expert services in the fields of Management Consulting, System Integration, Application Management and Business Solutions. At present, more than 1.800 employees provide consulting services to and support more than 300 customers world-wide from our 13 locations in Germany (Ludwigsburg (2), Frankfurt, Munich, Nuremberg, Essen, Wolfsburg, Berlin), Switzerland (Zurich, Regensdorf), England (Birmingham), the U.S. (Atlanta), China (Shanghai) and Romania (Cluj-Napoca).

The MHP philosophy: Excellence.

MHP Excellence in Management- and IT-Consulting for Automotive.

Exclusive look behind the scenes

The MHP Digital Initiative and Innovation project house is the core of MHP approach to take on the challenges, posed by the digital transformation.

Digitization is invading the business environment, provoking significant changes in the way we work, communicate, and sell. This has given rise to new opportunities and challenges. As of this, MHP decided to embrace the digital transformation and to setup our own digitalization & innovation department. We will deliver digital products & customer experience beyond the scope of the existing MHP core business from our own digital talents and culture, to build a new digital era of sales.

The Sales Digitization and Innovation project house is the pioneer team for researching, experimenting, testing, and developing the cutting edge digital technologies and partnerships that will meet the future needs of MHP Digital strategy based on human centered design and agile development.

How to apply?

Please apply with your resume, credentials and a brief letter of motivation.

MHP - A Porsche Company is an equal opportunities employer and we welcome applications from all suitably qualified persons.

Contact

name: Junior Business Development Consultant (m\/w)
description:
Job Title
Junior Business Development Consultant (m/w)


21-Nov-2018

Job Description
Danfoss ist ein Pionier und Weltmarktführer in Bezug auf energieeffiziente Lösungen. Zu unserem umfangreichen Produktportfolio zählen u.a. Komponenten für Kälte- und Wärmesysteme, Produkte zu erneuerbaren Energien oder für mobile Arbeitsmaschinen, sowie Frequenzumrichter zur Drehzahlregelung von Elektromotoren im Nieder- und Mittelspannungsbereich. Unsere Lösungen werden in der Regel vom Maschinen- und Anlagenbau eingesetzt und erfüllen die Anforderungen unterschiedlichster Anwendungsbereiche weltweit.
Als stetig wachsendes Unternehmen sucht Danfoss nach motivierten Mitarbeitern, die gemeinsam mit uns an unserem Erfolg arbeiten wollen.

Aktuell suchen wir für unser Segment Drives am Standort Offenbach am Main einen Junior Business Development Consultant (m/w). In dieser Funktion unterstützen Sie den europäischen Vertrieb taktisch und strategisch durch die Ausarbeitung von effektiven Analyse- und Planungswerkzeugen sowie die Unterstützung bei der Untersuchung von zukünftigen Wachstumsmärkten und schaffen somit die Grundlage für unseren Geschäftserfolg von morgen.

Ihre Aufgaben:
Ausarbeitung effektiver Analyse- und Planungswerkzeuge, weitgehend auf der Basis von MS Produkten (u.a. Excel, PowerPoint)
Aufbau und Betreiben einer gemeinsamen Arbeitsplattform auf der Basis von MS Sharepoint, um teamübergreifenden Wissenstransfer zu gewährleisten
Ausarbeitung von Wettbewerbsanalysen und Go-To-Market Strategien
Unterstützung bei strategischen Projekten für zukünftige Märkte
Unterstützung bei der Erstellung von Wachstumsperspektiven, der Einführung von Produkten sowie der Marketing Budgetplanung
Unterstützung des Leiters Strategisches Marketing im Tagesgeschäft
Ihr Profil:
Abgeschlossenes Studium in Betriebswirtschaftslehre oder einem vergleichbaren Studiengang
Erste Berufserfahrung im Bereich Vertrieb, Business Development oder Strategic Marketing, ggf. auch durch Praktika oder Werkstudententätigkeit
Zahlenaffinität und sehr gute IT Kenntnisse (MS Office, MS Sharepoint, CRM, Business Intelligence, VBA Programmierung)
Ausgeprägte analytische und konzeptionelle Fähigkeiten, sowie hohe Eigenmotivation und Selbstständigkeit
Freude an der Zusammenarbeit in einem internationalen Team
Fließende Deutschkenntnisse, sehr gute Englischkenntnisse; weitere Fremdsprache von Vorteil
Was wir Ihnen bieten

Auf Sie warten ein eigenständiges Aufgabengebiet mit umfassender Produktschulung, ein leistungsgerechtes Gehalt, sowie ausgezeichnete Entwicklungsperspektiven eines globalen Unternehmens. Außerdem garantieren wir Ihnen einen abwechslungsreichen Arbeitsalltag und eine angenehme Arbeitsatmosphäre in einem kollegialen Umfeld.

Haben wir Ihr Interesse geweckt? Dann freuen wir uns auf Ihre Bewerbung unter Angabe Ihres frühestmöglichen Eintrittstermins und Ihrer Gehaltsvorstellung.

Bei Fragen wenden Sie sich an Raimondo Farruggia, Senior Recruiter, unter +49 69 8902 153.

Please apply at your earliest convenience. We do not have an application deadline but accept applications as long as the job is posted.The position will be closed down once we have found the right candidate.

A team player quality and excellent people skills
A can-do attitude with an ability to think both strategically and creatively

name: Business Analyst
description:
Challengers Wanted.
See how we're embracing the challenges of tomorrow!

The Kronos HRIT team is a collaborative group of individuals who support the Kronos application for companies across Koch. We provide value to Koch by transforming the Kronos user experience, eliminating manual processes, and providing accurate time records for employees’ pay. Members of this team work together to advance our initiatives and strategy. Members of our team are interested in expanding their knowledge of the system while working to support customers through requests and projects. A successful candidate is motivated to learn, think critically about processes and how to make improvements and is comfortable working independently in a fast-paced environment.

This opportunity is for an entry level Kronos Business Analyst. You will primarily focus on providing essential system support to ensure a smooth customer experience, through utilization of our Service Now support ticket system. With increased system experience, additional work efforts will include researching, designing, and implementing solutions through small to mid-size projects. Interpersonal skills, effective collaboration, analytical skills, functional design and problem-solving skills will be key to your success in this role.

Open to remote candidates with preferred locations in Kansas City, Atlanta, Reno, Dallas, Chicago, Green Bay or Wichita.

A Day In The Life Typically Includes:
Communicate with business contacts to gather detailed requirements
Perform maintenance and configuration activities for Kronos modules such as accrual, timekeeper, and attendance
Partner with customers on support activities by responding to and resolving customer requests
Partner and collaborate with a diverse IT team including systems analysts, business analysts, architects and vendors
Leading smaller projects and efforts to implement solutions
Seek to identify opportunities to optimize application performance and utilization
Identify opportunities to improve and transform internal business processes and day to day activities
Developing your knowledge, skills and leadership abilities for future career advancement
What You Will Need:

Basic Qualifications:
1+ years of experience supporting a Kronos system, either in an IT setting or Payroll/HR Admin role
Experience supporting or knowledge of Kronos Timekeeper and Accruals modules
Experience identifying process improvement opportunities
Excellent computer skills, including Microsoft Outlook, Microsoft Excel, and Microsoft Word
What Will Put You Ahead?

Preferred Qualifications:
Degree in MIS, CIS, or CS obtained or in progress
3+ years of experience supporting a Kronos system, either in an IT setting or Payroll/HR Admin role.
Experience supporting or implementing modules such as Timekeeper, Accruals, Attendance and Scheduler.
Experience using a service ticketing system, such as ServiceNow.
Familiarity with programming languages such as SQL
Knowledge of ITIL including IT implementation methodologies (SDLC, Agile, etc) or equivalent IT service management training & experience
Experience writing and/or executing test plans
Experience creating end user training materials, either written or recorded.
Project Management experience, including MS Project or Planview.
Learn more about us
Salary and benefits commensurate with experience.
We are an equal opportunity employer. Minority/Female/Disabled/Veteran
Except where prohibited by state law, all offers of employment are conditioned upon successfully passing a drug test.

This employer uses E-Verify. Please visit the following website for additional information: www.kochcareers.com/doc/Everify.pdf
Follow us

name: MBA Summer Intern – Siemens Management Consulting
description:
Division: Corporate Technology
Business Unit: Corporate Technology
Requisition Number: 230452
Primary Location: United States-Florida-Orlando
Assignment Category: Part-time temporary
Experience Level: Entry level
Education Required Level: Bachelor's Degree
Travel Required: 80%

Division Description:

Siemens is a global technology powerhouse that has stood for engineering excellence, innovation, quality, reliability and internationally for more than 165 years. As a global technology company, Siemens is rigorously leveraging the advantages that this setup provides. To tap business opportunities in both new and established markets, the Company is organized in eight Divisions: Power and Gas, Power Generation Services, Energy Management, Building Technologies, Mobility, Digital Factory, Process Industries and Drives, and Financial Services. Our support functions are split into two organizations, Corporate Core and Corporate Services. These organizations provide essential services to better enable responsible and profitable growth.
For more information, please visit:
https://www.siemens.com/us/en/home/company/about/businesses.html







Job Description:

MBA Summer Intern – Siemens Management Consulting
What is Siemens Management Consulting?

We are Siemens Management Consulting (SMC), the top management strategy consultancy for one of the world’s most innovative engineering and technology companies. Our mission is to inspire and transform Siemens businesses worldwide and launch talent into senior management roles. Join us and discover where your talents could take you.
The United States is the world’s largest economy – and the largest market for Siemens. That's why it is the home to some of Siemens’ global headquarters such as Oil & Gas or the software business. Our consultants have been supporting Siemens in the Americas as part of international project teams for many years. Since 2018, they've also been working locally from our new office in the sunshine state Florida.
Our Orlando team, comprising international and local talent, is helping to shape the future of the American market for Siemens, advising on growth and innovation, digitalization, M&A, government and society as well as regional strategies.
What you'll do
As a MBA Summer Intern, you'll develop international business strategies to solve some of today’s most complex challenges in the fields of electrification, automation and digitalization. This is a client-facing role, and you'll act globally. Ready for the challenge?
· Analyze markets and competitors; develop recommendations for our clients
· Develop business plans and strategies in close collaboration with our clients
· Conduct expert interviews and facilitate workshops
· Prepare presentations for top management
A career at SMC means you'll see the real-world impact of your thinking from day one. Join us and start shaping your future today.
Required Knowledge/Skills, Education, and Experience:
· Currently enrollment at an MBA business school
· 2-5 years’ experience in strategy consulting, a renowned industrial enterprise or start-up (ideally with strategic project experience)
· Previous consulting and/or industry expertise highly preferred
· International work experience highly preferred
· Outstanding analytical and conceptual skills and an entrepreneurial mindset
· Highly developed communication skills
· Team player with strong interpersonal skills
Minimum Education Required: Bachelor’s Degree
Travel: Interns will be expected to travel approximately 80%

name: Consultant, Construction Claims (Schedule Analysis, P6 Experience req)
description:
Job Description
We've been in business since 1999 and our staff on average has 7 years of service with our firm with 40% of our staff having been here over 10 years. We offer a great work environment, 5 weeks PTO, medical time, free health insurance, on-site fitness facility, length of service bonuses and a great wellness program.

The Rhodes Group has an opening for experienced and entry level Construction Consultants. Candidates should have a minimum of 1 years construction experience in the preparation and evaluation of construction claims on complex construction projects. The Consultant is primarily responsible to carry out the various analyses for the submission or evaluation of a construction claim. Must be able to research, analyze and evaluate construction documentation, specifications, CPM schedules and construction cost accounting data. The consultant is responsible to complete assignments within the time and budgetary constraints as outlined by supervisor. Must possess strong self management, analytical organizational and communication skills. Experience with scheduling/delay analysis, productivity analysis, cost/damage analysis, and document review/issue analysis is preferred but not required.

Expert knowledge of MS Office (specifically Excel) software is encouraged. Knowledge of Primavera P3 & P6, Summation Pro preferred but not required. B.S. degree in Engineering preferred or relevant industry experience. Must be willing to travel domestically and internationally (potentially for extended periods time).

Salary commensurate with experience. Excellent benefits package (Medical, Dental, Vision, Generous PTO, Life, Disability, 401(k)) along with on-site fitness facility.

PRIMARY DUTIES:
Research and analysis of issues related to disputes on construction projects
Organizing information to facilitate effective data access and analysis including preparation of quantitative exhibits
Proactively identify a problem, visualize potential solutions and assist with the creation of potential solutions
Document problems/solutions and summarize findings into opinions or conclusions
Distill essential project facts from information and documentation
BASIC QUALIFICATIONS:
Bachelor’s or Master’s Degree in Business, Engineering, Accounting, Finance or Construction Management
Minimum of one (1) year of industry experience specifically in the analysis, development and preparation of construction claims
Familiarity with project controls, scheduling, and/or construction cost management
EIT, PE or CPA certification desired
Hold or be willing to acquire industry specific professional certifications (CCP, PSP, CCIFP), as necessary
PREFERRED SKILLS:
High-level knowledge of MS Excel including the ability to input and compile data reliably and create charts and graphs. Experience creating and working with PivotTables and PivotCharts. Use of basic functions such as sorting, formatting, cell referencing and basic formulas. Ability to work with advanced formulas including but not limited to IF, LOOKUP, CONCATENATE, Text and Date functions. Ability to sort, filter and group data. Ability to insert and edit charts and tables and apply conditional and other advanced formatting as necessary.
High level of quantitative and qualitative research and analytical skills
Construction field experience encouraged but not required
Experience with industry software programs such as:
Summation Pro
Relativity
Primavera P3/P6
Microsoft Office (Excel, Word, PowerPoint, Access, Outlook)
Must be willing to travel domestically and internationally (potentially for extended periods of time)
Excellent communication (written and verbal), mathematical and organizational skills
Fluency in English required and other languages strongly considered as a plus

Company Description
The Rhodes Group is a leading construction consulting firm with global reach and experience across all major industries. Our comprehensive services span the life of a project from preconstruction through formal dispute resolution. These services include Claims Consulting, Expert Testimony, Project Alignment Services, CPM Scheduling and 3D Modeling. Our experience includes multi-million and multi-billion dollar projects that range in function from professional sports stadiums to liquefied natural gas facilities.

name: Reporting and Operational Analytics Consultant
description:
Job ID : ******
Location : Northbrook, IL US
Level : Entry Level Professional
Job Category : Data Science & AnalyticsDescription :
Where good people build rewarding careers.
Think that working in the insurance field can't be exciting, rewarding and challenging? Think again. You'll help us reinvent protection and retirement to improve customers' lives. We'll help you make an impact with our training and mentoring offerings. Here, you'll have the opportunity to expand and apply your skills in ways you never thought possible. And you'll have fun doing it. Join a company of individuals with hopes, plans and passions, all using and developing our talents for good, at work and in life.

Job Description

Claims Reporting and Operational Analytics function, is responsible to assist management and key business partners with an understanding of reporting metrics and trend analysis on various levels of complexity. This function identifies data, reporting, and analytical automation opportunities that focus on turning data consumption from reporting to actionable analytical data stories. Through transformations and business intelligence tools, this job function will assist in designing and creation of analytical workbench across all operational disciplines.

This individual contributor is responsible for developing and implementing technical and analytical solutions to address business needs. This individual compiles data, creates operational and reporting analytics on historical operations, strategic business metrics and market trend information using multiple software tools. This individual utilizes fundamental statistics and mathematical concepts, database structures, business intelligence tools, and various programming languages to identify complex problems and assists in developing innovative, analytical self-services strategies and solutions. This individual works collaboratively with other Claims Analytics and Data Management teams to maintain full awareness of changing business processes and data structures. The individual must be able to communicate business meaning of analyzed metrics, conclusions and strategies to technical and non-technical audiences in Line Management/Operations/SIU teams. The individual also delivers compassionate service that is fast, fair, and easy, to ensure customer satisfaction. The individual works independently, prioritizes the individual's own responsibilities, and manages the individual's own workload. The individual consistently meets band level behaviors, production, quality, and/or customer service goals.

Key Responsibilities
Integrates data across various source systems, both internal and external, when needed to develop complex analyses based on operational, economic and/or financial data
Conducts root cause analysis and dependency analysis for complex data aggregations and joins
Develop new reporting self-service tools, which will be used by others to obtain business and financial metrics for the line of work
Performs a variety of complex analyses to identify trends, analyzing business metrics to provide Line Management/Operations with data in order to support business decisions, strategies and processes
Identifies and communicates how analytical trends, metrics and results may contribute as input to overall business strategy
Independently and proactively manages projects with effective communication of timelines, status and progress with both manager and project requestor
Applies insurance industry, Allstate product, claims, software and vendor knowledge to innovate current analytical processes
Job Qualifications
Bachelor's degree in related technical area of study including Finance, Mathematics Industrial Engineering
Prior experience with application of data and analysis projects from school or other corporate institutions preferred
Strong mathematical and analytical skills
Prior knowledge and/or experience of computer applications such as Business Object, SQL Developer, SAS, MS: Access, Excel, PowerPoint; Tableau, etc.
Self-starter with motivation and discipline to complete work on time with limited oversight
Teamwork and interpersonal skills demonstrated by ability to work successfully on cross-functional teams and/or projects
Ability to work on multiple projects concurrently
Experience organizing hypotheses, results and analysis into an effective communication with written and verbal skills
Applies ability to learn and leverage technical and analytical skills in support of team objectives
Knowledge and application of advanced mathematical concepts to solve problems and prepare data for analysis
Ability to thrive in both structured and project-oriented work environments
The candidate(s) offered this position will be required to submit to a background investigation, which includes a drug screen.
Good Work. Good Life. Good Hands.
As a Fortune 100 company and industry leader, we provide a competitive salary - but that's just the beginning. Our Total Rewards package also offers benefits like tuition assistance, medical and dental insurance, as well as a robust pension and 401(k). Plus, you'll have access to a wide variety of programs to help you balance your work and personal life -- including a generous paid time off policy.
Learn more about life at Allstate. Connect with us on Twitter, Facebook, Instagram and LinkedIn or watch a video.

name: (Senior) Consultant SAP TM
description:
You can choose to work for one of the top companies in the automotive industry.

Or for more - with MHP.

We are looking for you as:

(Senior) Consultant SAP TM
Code number: MHP-D-0-E
Entry level: Professionals
Location: Atlanta
Organization: MHP A Porsche Company
Tasks
Be part of challenging projects in process and IT consulting with focus on the automotive industry
Develop innovative concepts and implement sophisticated consulting solutions in the field of Supply Chain Management
Define detailed blueprint for development requirements
Deploy process, quality and cost-optimized logistics concepts
Create long term relationships with clients
Identify and lead business development opportunities
Achieve strong reputation as a business advisor
Take over responsibility as (sub) project team leader
Qualifications
Bachelor's or Master's Degree in Business Administration, Economics, Engineering or equivalent education
8 years of work experience in consulting or in the automotive industry
6 years of SAP TM (Transport Management) experience (process & customizing)
4 SAP full lifecycle implementations
SAP certifications are a big plus
Profound SAP project and go-live experience (SAP implementation approach)
Fluency in English (multi-lingual preferred)
Professional appearance with strong customer focus
Analytical and structured working attitude
Excellent communication skills (written, verbal) and interpersonal skills
Strong teamwork capability
Willingness to be based in Atlanta, GA and travel 80-100%
US Citizen/Green Card/EAD required (we are unable to sponsor visas at this time)
At a Glance

MHP A Porsche Company is one of the leading management and IT consultancies in particular, for the automotive industry and a subsidiary of Porsche AG (81.8%). The unique MHP approach to consulting is based on the symbiosis of management and IT consulting services. MHP, as a process supplier, optimizes and digitizes customer processes throughout the value chain with its expert services in the fields of Management Consulting, System Integration, Application Management and Business Solutions. At present, more than 1.800 employees provide consulting services to and support more than 300 customers world-wide from our 13 locations in Germany (Ludwigsburg (2), Frankfurt, Munich, Nuremberg, Essen, Wolfsburg, Berlin), Switzerland (Zurich, Regensdorf), England (Birmingham), the U.S. (Atlanta), China (Shanghai) and Romania (Cluj-Napoca).

The MHP philosophy: Excellence.

MHP Excellence in Management- and IT-Consulting for Automotive.

Exclusive look behind the scenes

The MHP Digital Initiative and Innovation project house is the core of MHP approach to take on the challenges, posed by the digital transformation.

Digitization is invading the business environment, provoking significant changes in the way we work, communicate, and sell. This has given rise to new opportunities and challenges. As of this, MHP decided to embrace the digital transformation and to setup our own digitalization & innovation department. We will deliver digital products & customer experience beyond the scope of the existing MHP core business from our own digital talents and culture, to build a new digital era of sales.

The Sales Digitization and Innovation project house is the pioneer team for researching, experimenting, testing, and developing the cutting edge digital technologies and partnerships that will meet the future needs of MHP Digital strategy based on human centered design and agile development.

How to apply?

Please apply with your resume, credentials and a brief letter of motivation.

MHP - A Porsche Company is an equal opportunities employer and we welcome applications from all suitably qualified persons.

Contact

Apply now at:

https://career5.successfactors.eu/sfcareer/jobreqcareer?jobId=6748&company=porschecar&username=

name: EHS Program Consultant
description:
EHS Program Consultant
NA-United States-Delaware-Wilmington
Overall Role DescriptionSpecialty Products is a division, and one of
three intended future companies, that make up DowDuPont. Specialty
Products Division is a leader in innovation composed of
technology-driven specialty businesses. We work with customers across
multiple industries to advance their best ideas and deliver real-world
products and smart solutions. Our world-class product innovation and
application development capabilities help customers solve complex
problems in the electronics, transportation, building and
construction, health and wellness, food, personal care, safety and
consumer goods industries. With a global workforce of more than
30,000, together we aim to empower the world with the essential
innovations to thrive.
This individual would provide support for ongoing Specialty Products
EHS programs at operations and non-operations sites globally. The
individual would work collaboratively with DuPont, Dow, and contract
personnel to implement and drive programs. This individual will report
to the Specialty Products EHS Programs Manager. Key Responsibilities
Collaboratively work with Business EHs leaders and EHS competency
leaders to support Specialty Products SHE programs at operations
and non-operations facilities
Understand site EHS risk model to prioritize activities
Work collaboratively with Dow and DuPont EHS personnel to identify
EHS best practices that can be implemented within Specialty
Products
Participate in external benchmarking of EHS systems and processes
Understand the site/business/corporate needs for EHS Continuous
Improvement Projects
Champion management of change in EHS Programs
Drive Operational Discipline across all daily tasks and assist
sites/businesses with Operational Discipline improvements
Further develop personal understanding of EHS systems such as
incident investigation, management of change, and auditing
Provide recognition, coaching, collaboration, and training
Required Qualifications - Knowledge, Skills, and Abilities:
Bachelor s degree in science, engineering, or EHS field
Three to five years industrial experiences with experience in a
leadership role (influence or direct supervision)
Ability to work collaboratively with subject matter experts
Fundamental understanding of EHS and Operational Discipline
Experience with hDow systems and work practices is a plus
Demonstrated strong data management and analytical skills
Strong project management, organization, and prioritization skills
Excellent written and oral communication skills
Experience with organizational culture change/development including
demonstrated ability to embrace and champion change
Ability to train, coach, and mentor others
Excellent leadership skills and ability to work independently and
collaboratively

description:

Job Description

Job Family Summary

The Product Operations Support Team is responsible for collaborating with clients to enable them to make objective customer-focused decisions by providing analytical insight and ensuring trusted actionable data. The team is responsible for analytics, as well as serving in a consultant role to teams across Product Operations providing adhoc requests, implementation metrics, performance scorecards and other analytic visualization reporting.

Job Summary

As Product Data Consultant you will be responsible for collaborating with clients to enable them with trusted actionable data to break down business problems into solvable components by assessing the requirements and/or business implications to arrive at recommended solutions. You will support the delivery of ad hoc requests and data quality efforts to clients.

Key Responsibilities
Gather requirements/understand purpose of request
Provide data extraction and analytical support for a variety of internal customers and external recipients
Analytical support includes inspecting and cleaning data to provide useful information and to suggest conclusions to the client for decision making.
Support the needs of modeling and analytics by delivering data based on client requirements.
Prepare test data, reconcile data sources and execute functional tests for each request
Documents programs and queries and supports the development of the PI WIKI
Works with data stewards in the testing/profiling of data and validation of newly captured data to ensure proper operation and accuracy
Support troubleshooting data quality issues - documentation/communication of resolution
Job Qualifications

Knowledge/Skills/Abilities/Experience
Bachelors or Masters/MBA majoring in a quantitative field such as Math, Business or Computer Science or equivalent work experience
2-3 years of related experience
Intermediate analytical skills
Solid experience in time and task management
Strong Attention to details
Intermediate Microsoft Office skills
Intermediate technology fluency in tools and software/programming languages with key analytic applications (SAS, MySQL, PL/SQL, Oracle, UNIX, OLAP, Tableau)
Intermediate written and verbal communication skills including the ability to effectively collaborate with multi-disciplinary groups and all organizational levels

name: Project Manager
description:
Consider a Career at MTM

From entry level customer service positions, to challenging technology and leadership roles, MTM offers a wealth of employment opportunities. Our corporate culture promotes healthy living, excellent work-home life balance, and strategic career advancement opportunities in a rewarding work environment where you will make a positive impact in your community and beyond. In particular, MTM is committed to providing physical activity and wellness opportunities for our employees, and we have been recognized as a Gold Level Recipient of the American Heart Association’s Fit-Friendly Worksites Recognition program. As an employer, MTM offers excellent benefits and welcomes diversity; we are an affirmative action and equal opportunity employer. We invite you to apply for any of our open positions and look forward to providing you an opportunity to develop your career as a member of our team. If you can't find what you are looking for, please check out our affiliate Ride Right for more opportunities.

MTM, Inc. continues to grow and we are seeking a Project Manager!

MTM, Inc. is a healthcare services and transportation management company whose mission is to develop innovative solutions for accessing healthcare, increasing independence, and connecting community resources. MTM is made up of people who share a passion for making a positive impact. Our culture promotes healthy living, excellent work/life balance, and career advancement opportunities. MTM is a fun place to work, where individuality is encouraged and hard work is rewarded.

The Project Manager works in collaboration with operations, corporate support departments, to ensure the most appropriate and cost-effective delivery of transportation services are provided. Will act as the internal liaison between departments and clients to ensure that the location is fully compliant with all contractual requirements.

Responsibilities:
Contract oversight and facilitation of client needs with anticipation of growth
Continually analyze program needs and productivity and adjust staffing and resources to ensure cost effectiveness
Responsible for employee training and development
Thorough understanding of contract and awareness of changes
Thorough understanding of MTM policies and employee handbook guidelines
Develop a working relationship with client and MTM Assessment staff to ensure exceptional customer service needs and problem resolution processes are in place
Act as a liaison between MTM and client to address any concerns or issues that may arise and do so in a timely manner
Thorough knowledge of scheduling, route creation and planning and dispatching
Maintain a “Safety First” attitude with client and personnel
Good understanding or local climate needs and issues pertaining to the passenger transportation industry
Capability of addressing any questions / concerns regarding site transit program
Develop and maintain thorough knowledge of MTM departments and compliance programs within each
Identify, evaluate, and develop strategies in relation to livability, public involvement, and the transportation disadvantaged population
Participate in education outreach programs for public involvement
Work collaboratively with key stakeholders, internal and external
Attend regular meetings with the client to report on progress, field any questions, concerns, and/or complaints, as well as update the client on ongoing projects
Oversight over all planning activities
Communicate with assigned manager as needed to maximize efficiencies and resolve issues
Perform additional duties as assigned or required
Minimum Qualifications:
Bachelor’s degree preferred or relevant experience substituting on a 1 for 1 year basis with equivalent experience in a related field
Experience establishing key processes and procedures
Proven experience in transit operation’s and management of staff
Proven experience supervising and monitoring the delivery of contractual services
Previous management experience in the Para-Transit or livery industries preferred
Prior contract and or project management experience preferred
Previous experience working with senior citizens or persons with disabilities preferred
Transportation Management experience and working with people with disabilities is preferred
Must possess a valid driver’s license
Must be authorized to work in the United States and not require work authorization sponsorship by our company for this position now or in the future
Competency Based Qualifications:
Ability to acquire in-depth knowledge of MTM operations, company policies, and guidelines
Extensive analytical and proven data collection methods
Exceptional interpretation and problem solving skills
Ability to schedule, organize and prioritize multiple tasks
Must be able to evaluate and resolve problems and issues in a constructive manner
Must possess excellent interpersonal skills and ability to work with a variety of people and job positions
Ability to maintain high level of confidentiality
What’s in it for you?
Paid vacation
Holiday Pay
Health and Life Insurance Plans
Dental and Vision Plans
401(k)
Onsite Gym
Wellness Screenings
Birthday Holiday
Training Development
Casual Dress Environment
Scholarship Program
Healthy Market
Free Coffee
*These benefits may not be available at all locations

Equal Opportunity Employer: MTM is an equal opportunity employer. MTM considers qualified candidates with a criminal history in a manner consistent with the requirements of applicable local, State, and Federal law. If you are in need of accommodations, please contact People & Culture at (636) 561-5686 or talent@mtm-inc.net.

name: Product Operations Consultant
description:
Job ID : ******
Location : Northbrook, IL US
Level : Entry Level Professional
Job Category : ProductDescription :
Where good people build rewarding careers.
Think that working in the insurance field can't be exciting, rewarding and challenging? Think again. You'll help us reinvent protection and retirement to improve customers' lives. We'll help you make an impact with our training and mentoring offerings. Here, you'll have the opportunity to expand and apply your skills in ways you never thought possible. And you'll have fun doing it. Join a company of individuals with hopes, plans and passions, all using and developing our talents for good, at work and in life.

Job Description

The Product Operations Consultant falls within the Encompass Product Management job family which is responsible for leading and executing on business strategies and tactics that support the profitable growth of the business unit.
Key Responsibilities
Coordinate and implement assigned countrywide underwriting tactics and execute timely and quality delivery on projects of moderate complexity ensuring appropriate communications to all impacted groups. Includes project design, pre-implementation and post-implementation actions.
Provide input into the design of new products including product features, rate, underwriting changes, and/or technology
Prepare assigned work to support pre-implementation activities to include project development, communication strategy, launch design and/or testing plans
Assist with the design of products that meet our business objectives yet also balance agency impacts for ease of use
Perform assigned post-implementation activities to include quality testing, issue resolution, and call log management
Gathers key project measures and provide insights regarding production and quality, comparing against project CBA or expected results; assist in making recommendations for course correction and implement if needed
Understand how the countrywide team's actions may impact the Allstate Brand.
Coordinate and implement countrywide underwriting rule changes in a timely, quality and cost effective manner.
Engage appropriate AORs and ensure Underwriting Express Change process flow is followed to ensure quality and consistency in roll outs
Establish and maintain key internal IT relationships
Identify and evolve the current underwriting implementation process for efficiencies and effectiveness
Conduct moderate analysis on recurring underwriting measures to ensure key underwriting trends are identified and communicated to ensure that it aligns with business goals.
Communicate results to the Underwriting Department and implement assigned tactics to improve business results.
Engage other AORs to identify the root cause of changes to key performance measures and identify tactics to address
Conduct moderate countrywide level analysis to identify issues/trends for key quality characteristics;
Leverage pertinent underwriting tools to meet margin and profitability goals
Maintain on-going view of PML, understanding how it contributes to the broader Brand and Company targets. Identify, as necessary, the need for strategies to address changes to PML.
Correct Class Pursuits:
Implement assigned moderately complex countrywide correct class changes.
Support correct class goals by partnering with process owners to evaluate and consider CCP impacts of product, pricing and RMP changes
Product Distribution Management:
Partner with Correct Class and Compliance Team to communicate countrywide trended results
Leverage agency performance data to improve business results
State Manager and Sales Support
Proactively considers the impacts of project deliverables on Field Sales Leaders and agents, recommend and build tactics to proactively address.
Team Effectiveness:
Coordinate efforts of all team members to ensure flawless execution of product deliverables
Leverage the skills, knowledge, and experience of others to optimize business results
Develop and maintain strong relationships
Job Qualifications
2 years of related experience; college degree preferred
P & C Insurance experience preferred
Basic knowledge in the use of data sources and applications to conduct research
Analyzes data and reviews analysis from others
Strong Computer proficiency in Microsoft Office; Advanced - Excel skills
Strong written and verbal communication skills including the ability to effectively collaborate with multi-disciplinary groups and all organizational levels
Good presentation skills
Can effectively manage multiple concurrent assignments in a timely manner
Works effectively in a team environment
The candidate(s) offered this position will be required to submit to a background investigation, which includes a drug screen.
Good Work. Good Life. Good Hands.
As a Fortune 100 company and industry leader, we provide a competitive salary - but that's just the beginning. Our Total Rewards package also offers benefits like tuition assistance, medical and dental insurance, as well as a robust pension and 401(k). Plus, you'll have access to a wide variety of programs to help you balance your work and personal life -- including a generous paid time off policy.
Learn more about life at Allstate. Connect with us on Twitter, Facebook, Instagram and LinkedIn or watch a video.

Allstate generally does not sponsor individuals for employment-based visas for this position.
