name: Paramilitary Operations Officer/Specialized Skills Officer
description:
Description

Qualifications

How to Apply

Description
*Successful candidates for this position may be eligible for a one-time hiring bonus of up to 25% of their base pay

As a Paramilitary Operations Officer/Specialized Skills Officer for the CIA, you will join a cadre of action- and results-oriented professionals who accept significant, demanding responsibilities and accountability for results. Paramilitary Operations Officers and Specialized Skills Officers are distinct occupations in the Directorate of Operations (DO), but together they play a unique role and provide unique capabilities in support of conventional and unconventional operations overseas.

All DO officers are hired at an entry level and train as they are expected to work - as one team. DO officers begin their careers spending one to two years learning the foundations of clandestine operational tradecraft via classroom training, practical exercise, and on-the-job experience. Paramilitary Operations Officers and Specialized Skills Officers must successfully complete foundational training as a DO Operations Officer.

Additionally, Paramilitary Operations Officers are required to successfully complete specialized training to prepare for service in hazardous and austere environments overseas.

Specialized Skills Officers focus on operating and maintaining infrastructure necessary to facilitate and support missions conducted under CIA-unique authorities. You will serve primarily at CIA Headquarters, but there are frequent opportunities for temporary duty travel and/or assignments overseas.

This position requires a 5-year Contract Term Agreement. Learn more about the Contract Term Agreement.

Offices of the CIA – Directorate of Operations

The Directorate of Operations (DO) strengthens national security and foreign policy objectives through the clandestine collection of human intelligence (HUMINT), and by conducting covert action as directed by the President. Learn more about the Directorate of Operations.

See our work in action:

Click to watch the video on a separate page.

Life at CIA

In addition to a comprehensive benefits package, the CIA offers exciting career opportunities and a dynamic environment. We're on the forefront of world-altering events – as they happen. So working here isn't just a job, it's a mindset and a lifestyle.

Add to Job CartRemove From Cart

Qualifications
US citizenship required (dual-national US citizens eligible). All positions require relocation to the Washington, DC metro area.

Minimum Qualifications:
Bachelor's degree from an accredited institution (applicants within one year of earning a four year degree will be considered); there is no preferred major or program of study (degrees from foreign academic institutions are accepted, but you are responsible for obtaining and providing CIA with a credential evaluation from an accredited firm confirming that the foreign degree is the equivalent of a BA/BS and/or MA/MS degree conferred by a US college or university)
GPA of at least 3.0 on a 4-point scale is preferred
Personal integrity
Strong interpersonal and communication skills (verbal and written)
Action- and results-oriented
Ability to work effectively as part of a team and independently;
Flexibility, adaptability, and commitment to the mission of the CIA and the Directorate of Operations
Ability to make decisions to meet existing conditions and mission requirements rather than relying on preset assumptions and goal
Desired Qualifications:

Competitive Paramilitary Operations Officer applicants have:
Military special operations or combat arms experience (ground, air or maritime)
Experience serving in combat leadership positions
Willingness to serve in hazardous and austere environments overseas (previous foreign travel and foreign language is valued, but not required)
Competitive Specialized Skills Officer applicants have knowledge or experience in:
Social communications, media, marketing, technology development, business, finance or legal
Military/merchant maritime industries, military psychological operations, and/or information operations
Military aviation career fields such as:
Pilot (fixed wing, rotary wing, manned/unmanned)
Navigator
Flight engineer
Crew chief/mechanic
Maintenance
Avionics technician
Mission sensor operator
Forward air controller
Para-rescue
Special tactics squadron
Aviation foreign internal defense
Counterintelligence
All applicants must successfully complete:
A thorough medical and psychological exam
A polygraph interview
A comprehensive background investigation
To be considered suitable for Agency employment, applicants must generally not have used illegal drugs within the last 12 months. The issue of illegal drug use prior to 12 months ago is carefully evaluated during the medical and security processing.

Add to Job CartRemove From Cart

How to Apply
If you are ready to apply, add this position to your job cart. You can add up to four (4) positions. Job cart selections will only be retained during this site visit, so be sure to click "Apply Now" before closing the browser window. After clicking "Apply Now" you will be taken to the application account creation page. The positions will appear in the cart once you have created an account.

DO NOT submit multiple applications; this will only slow the review of your application and delay processing. Please read the Application Instructions carefully before you begin the online application process.
Important application instructions for this position:

The following items must be attached to your on-line application (PDF format preferred):
Unofficial transcripts for all degrees
Cover letter: please describe your knowledge, skills, abilities, and aspirations not evident from your resume, that make you a good candidate for the Directorate of Operations (1 page)
Qualifications Supplement - in a separate PDF attachment address the following questions:
Why does a career in public service appeal to you (1 paragraph)
Why do you wish to work for the Directorate of Operations (1 paragraph)
Other than the Directorate of Operations, what other career options are of interest to you (1 paragraph)
Describe one thing from your academic, military, or professional background that has prepared you for success in the Directorate of Operations (1 paragraph)
Complete this thought: "I do my best work when..." (1 paragraph)
Describe a time when you did not succeed, professionally or academically, and what you learned from that experience (2 paragraphs)
At the time of application, DO applicants select specific DO occupational specialties (i.e. Collection Management Officer, Staff Operations Officer, Operations Officer,Targeting Officer). Competitive applicants will continue to be asked to identify their DO occupational specialty preference(s) at various stages in the hiring process. It is not unusual for applicants to adjust their preference as they progress and learn more about the expectations and requirements of each occupational specialty.

Important Notice: Friends, family, individuals, or organizations may be interested to learn that you are seeking employment with the CIA. Their interest, however, may not be benign or in your best interest. Once you reveal your interest you lose control of that information. We ask all applicants to exercise discretion and good judgment in disclosing your interest in a position with the CIA. You will receive further guidance on this topic as you proceed through your CIA employment processing.

Watch the Application Process videos on a separate page.

An equal opportunity employer and a drug-free workforce.

name: Antenna Test Range Project Manager
description:
Job DescriptionThis is very interesting engineering position for a hands-on individual within the antenna test and measurement industry. There is travel associated with this job during customer visits for support and installations of our anechoic chambers, SAR equipment, and OTA test and measurement devices. We would like you to have some experience in the test & measurement (anechoic chambers), Telecommunications, RF technologies, Antenna verification industries. This would be similar to an applications engineering role, but with a stronger emphasis on overseeing programs, and supporting our customers throughout the entire new build and installation process. There is tremendous room for growth.

Position Duties
Ensure the cross-functional coordination of technical and commercial activity
Share experience and application knowledge with co-workers to maximize the efficiency in solving issues.
Work on specification and tenders, proposals and / commercial documentation, and demonstrate products' capabilities to potential and existing customers
Proactively contact customers and arrange visits to assess their specific needs, and ensure the program stays on task, on the budget, and delivery takes place in a timely manner.
Identify customer needs and maximize the application of our solutions. Gather customers requirements and general feedback, and report to management.
Ability to relate to customers and customer needs at a high technical level, set realistic customer expectations, translate that customer needs to our internal development team, and follow through to ensure a suitable solution is implemented that meets the customer needs.
Take ownership of technical issues, financials, customers needs, and work with our Application team experts to resolve more advanced issues when necessary.

Requirements
Must possess excellent computer skills, including knowledge of MS office and other common computer SW products (C# programming and MatLab experience are a plus).
Flexibility and adaptability to rapidly adjust tasks and travel priorities, according to customer needs
Capability and self-motivation to rapidly assimilate information, expand the knowledge base, and develop core competencies Applicant should be self-driven, seeking to assume responsibility and follow-through tasks to completion
Good interpersonal skills and customer-centric attitude
Ability to multitask and manage more than one project at the time
Capability to work within multi-disciplinary teams, and forge strong relationships in the process

Excellent oral and written communication skills

Must-Have
A Bachelors degree in Electrical Engineering, Electronics or similar field
3-8 years experience in RF, Antenna, Metrology or Telecommunication industry preferred - (This is NOT an entry level position)
Some experience with network analyzers, spectrum analyzers, and wireless communication protocols and test instruments is
necessary
Travel within the USA. Some limited international travel.
This position is a growth-oriented opportunity, and will give the candidate an opportunity to grow their knowledge within -
Telecommunications, RF technologies, Antenna design, verification, and test & measurement (anechoic chambers)
industries, as well as the certification procedures.
US Citizens or Green Card candidates only.
You must reside in the USA, and be fully authorized to work in the US. At this time we will not consider sponsoring Visa applications

name: Automotive Project Manager
description:
Oversee small to large teams of technical resources.
Must be able to define and manage systems scope, time-line, tasks, and guide resource assignments.
Compile status report and conduct status meetings with project team.

Excel, Powerpoint, Presentation skills, Organizational skills are key.
Engineering knowledge is extremely helpful.
Bachelor of Science Degree in any discipline.
2+ years relevant project management/support experience working in Engineering environment
Strong, demonstrated experience with Excel and Powerpoint
Demonstrate ability to manage all aspects of the development and implementation of assigned projects.

G-TECH Services, Inc. is a leading certified recruitment and placement firm that specializes in providing highly skilled staff in technical fields such as engineering, IT, procurement, finance and accounting. name: Business Analyst
description:
Job Title: Business Analyst Level: Entry Level (No experience required. You will receive on the job training) Number of positions available: 25 Interviews Start: Week of October 1

We are looking to hire 25 Entry Level Business Analysts within the next 3 weeks. This is an excellent opportunity for a recent college graduate with a business or STEM degree and a strong analytical mindset.

Employer Business Analysts work to transform data into actionable insights and bridge the gap between IT and business. Provide detailed project status reports

Ability to understand document data flow, systems and interdepartmental processes
The passion and drive to expand your skills

If you are looking for challenging work and a place to grow, consider Koontz Bryant Johnson Williams.

We offer interesting projects, a friendly atmosphere, professional development, and a competitive benefits package. Though our atmosphere is relaxed and friendly, we are results-oriented and client-focused. We look for employees who are willing to work hard, solve problems, and who can help us grow.

We are based in Richmond, Virginia. Rich with history, entertainment, and cultural opportunities, the Richmond region is Easy to Love. For a change of pace, in two hours or less you can be in the mountains, at the beach, or in Washington, D.C.

Qualified individuals should send their resum and cover letter to Human Resources, or send email to ***********************.

Koontz Bryant Johnson Williams is an Equal Opportunity Employer.

Open Positions

Senior Project Manager - Civil

Koontz Bryant Johnson Williams seeks a Senior Project Manager for residential, multi-family and mixed use developments. You and your team of engineers and technicians will design and prepare construction plans, submit plans to government agencies, and coordinate projects with clients.

As manager, you will:
Mentor, train (or oversee training of), and evaluate team members
Provide QA/QC on projects
Prepare proposals, budgets and schedules
Provide regular status reports to Clients and Management
Requirements:
10 years practical experience in all aspects of civil site design and stormwater management relating to land development.
Experience supervising engineers and/or designers
Proficiency in AutoCAD, Civil 3D
BSCE; PE license required
Koontz Bryant Johnson Williams offers interesting projects, a friendly atmosphere, professional development, and a competitive benefits package. Though our atmosphere is relaxed and friendly, we are results-oriented and client-focused. We look for employees who are willing to work hard, solve problems, and who can help us grow. We offer complete benefits package including 401(k), medical and dental plans and opportunities for growth.

Koontz Bryant Johnson Williams is an Equal Opportunity Employer.

Interested candidates please send resume to ***********************.

Survey Party Chief

Koontz Bryant Johnson Williams is an established, fast-growing civil engineering and land surveying firm headquartered in Henrico, VA. We are seeking Party Chief for our Survey Division.

Responsibilities include:
Direct a Survey Crew in topographic surveys, boundary surveys and construction stakeout.
Understand, operate and maintain the various types of instruments, measuring devices and equipment
Perform limited field and office computations and calculations
Train crew members
Cut and clear brush as needed
Operate instrument, set stakes
Keep detailed notes and sketches
Operate level
Use moderately heavy equipment at times
Set up baselines
Requirements:
2+ years experience as Party Chief
Valid driver's license and acceptable driving record
Koontz Bryant Johnson Williams offers a competitive wage, complete benefits package including 401(k), medical and dental plans and opportunities for growth.

Koontz Bryant Johnson Williams is an equal opportunity employer.

Interested candidates please send resume to ***********************.

Civil Engineer

We are seeking civil engineer to prepare site plans for residential and commercial land development projects. Responsibilities include design and preparation of construction plans, submittal of plans to government agencies, and coordination of projects with clients.

Requirements:
5+ years practical experience in civil engineering site design such as storm drain design, site grading, stormwater management and sediment control design relating to land development.
B.S. in Civil Engineering
Strong AutoCAD and computer abilities
Koontz Bryant Johnson Williams offers a competitive wage, complete benefits package including 401(k), medical and dental plans and opportunities for growth.

Koontz Bryant Johnson Williams is an equal opportunity employer.

Interested candidates please send resume to ***********************.

Survey Instrument Operator

Koontz Bryant Johnson Williams is an established, fast-growing civil engineering and land surveying firm headquartered in Henrico, VA. We are seeking an Instrument Operator for our Survey Division.

Responsibilities include:
Perform routine, manual work of survey technician with a survey party under the direction of the Party Chief
Operate electronic total station instrument, theodolite, transit, level and other surveying instruments
Clear brush
Determine and set markers
Read, review, and interpret maps, drawings and diagrams
Use survey equipment such as tapes, chains and sight rods; use moderately heavy equipment at times
Take field notes of readings and observations either manually or using an electronic field book
Make field sketches to record engineering data
Set and mark stakes for slopes, grades and other construction purposes
Determine lines, corners, elevations, grades, alignments, angles, positions and distances
Operate survey truck; maintain survey equipment and tools
Requirements:
2+ years surveying experience using on board data collector.
Knowledge of survey computations associated with routine surveys and construction stakeout/layout.

name: Project Manager/SR
description:
The person in this position will provide leadership, guidance and recommendations in managing all aspects of a project’s life cycle and works with all related areas of the organization to define requirements, deliverables and timeliness. Manages complex and intermediate project utilizing the PMI knowledge areas and process groups. They will utilize Project Management Institute Process (PMI) best practices and tools and integrate the Arizona Management Systems (AMS) to manage the strategic goals of the division. The type of assignments that a Senior Project Manager will be assigned versus an Intermediate or Entry level Project Manager differ by the complexity and interconnectivity of the type of projects they maybe assigned and the experience required to manage this type of project. The person in this position is expected to bring their experience and lessons they have learned managing in projects in the past to this role, particularly their risk management skills, communication management skills and stakeholder management skills. The Senior Project Manager is expected to anticipate "client" needs and propose solutions for them. This role should possess a deep knowledge of PMI, the Project Management Body of Knowledge (PMBOK), and the PMI framework that they are bringing to this role. The Senior Project Manager should also continually seek and capitalize upon opportunities to increase customer satisfaction and improve customer relationships. They are expected to develop their own project plans in Microsoft Project and report out on a regular cadence to leadership the project status. When a project begins to diverge the Senior Project Manager is expected to develop corrective action plans when projects require them and participate in strategic planning and building project plan around the annual improvement plans.

Manages communications and meetings for projects and teams, creates change and problem solves problems independently and is accountable for themselves and their teams. Participates in prioritization meetings with senior leadership to prioritize projects for the team, minimizes exposure and risks across projects, expected to possess expert knowledge in project management to identify opportunities for change and the ability to convey the need for change.

The Senior Project Manager may lead other team members on projects or they may directly manage many large scale projects on their own. This person is expected to lead and inspire other team members to manage projects effectively; evoke creative and innovative thinking from team members while helping them bring their ideas to fruition; coach and provide guidance to other team members to help them successfully complete projects and remove roadblocks for team members, Subject Matter Experts (SMEs) and contractors working on their projects to successfully complete projects on-time and meet expectations; and is expected to develop and define new approaches, challenge others to develop as leaders while clarifying roles and responsibilities. This person should also work with team members to develop them as leaders while clarifying roles and responsibilities. They should be to develop ways to monitor project areas and progress and take corrective action. They should possess the skills to handle difficult situations tactfully and discretely, and communicate sensitive information effectively.

Local Only Candidates - Resumes must specify the current location of the candidate, all those who do not state current location will not be considered. - AS A REMINDER - Candidates must be local at time of submission, and available for in person interviews within 1 week of the posting close date. Candidates must also be able to start within 2 weeks of an offer being made.

name: FEMA Project Manager
description:
Grounded in safety, quality, and ethics, our experts lead their fields and guide our work with rigor, a creative spirit, and vision for growth. We draw from more than 20 technical specialties around the globe and are committed to fostering an inclusive community of diverse talents, backgrounds, and expertise. We’re a place to apply your passion and collaborate with top environmental talents on work that’s critical to our clients and the communities they support. Join a team that has the environment down to a science.

Your Opportunity

Stantec is seeking individuals in various office locations with experience in FEMA's Risk MAP, TARC or HMTAP programs or other floodplain management and risk reduction initiatives. Responsibilities will include supporting all aspects of FEMA Risk MAP projects such as regulatory and non-regulatory product development, hazard mitigation planning, technical assistance, research and risk communication.

Your Capabilities and Credentials
Candidates must possess excellent written and verbal communication skills and have a strong understanding of risk communication, mitigation planning or floodplain management.
Ideal candidates should have at least 5 years' experience with some or all of the following: riverine modeling, coastal modeling, hazard mitigation technical assistance, research and design expertise, FIRM and FIS development, GIS, hazard mitigation plan development, grant writing or other floodplain related activities.
Being a Certified Floodplain Manager (CFM) is a plus.
Direct project experience with public outreach and communication meetings is also desired.
Candidate must have a degree in engineering, geography, environmental science or other related field.
Typical office environment working with computers and remaining sedentary for long periods of time. Field work may include exposure to the elements including inclement weather.

This description is not a comprehensive listing of activities, duties or responsibilities that may be required of the employee and other duties, responsibilities and activities may be assigned or may be changed at any time with or without notice.

Stantec is a place where the best and brightest come to build on each other’s talents, do exciting work, and make an impact on the world around us. Join us and redefine your personal best.

name: Entry Level Software Project Manager
description:
Job Description
We are seeking an Entry-Level Software Project Manager to join our team! You will be responsible for the management and delivery of software related projects across multiple customers. We are a start-up software company looking for a sharp individual with enough drive to learn quickly and deliver customer projects. This role will include travel to customer facilities, documenting deliverables, leading customer meetings, coordinating timelines with developers, and setting up new instances of the software platform. name: Healthcare Business Analyst Senior
description:
A healthcare business analyst job involves creating and implementing both reports and analysis that help maximize the effectiveness of health management initiatives and strategies. This position requires in-depth healthcare/clinical business knowledge. A healthcare business analyst manages healthcare/clinical outcome projects and acts as liaison between the business, clinicians, technology and the company to meet healthcare and clinical expectations and requirements. The healthcare business analyst guides and advises less experienced healthcare/clinical business analysts. The position is competent to work at the highest level of most phases of systems analysis.
Education: Bachelor's Degree required. In a healthcare/clinical field preferred.
Experience: Minimum five years of clinical experience in a Payor, Acute, or Ambulatory care environment e.g.: Nursing, Pharmacy, Public Health required
Additional Skills Required: Detailed knowledge of clinical information and processes. Ability to translate clinical data and information to a technical team. Detailed knowledge of healthcare regulatory mandates and reporting requirements. Detailed knowledge of operations in the health care industry and a strong understanding of business processes. Ability to work with teams and direct an organized work effort. Competent to work on complex analysis assignments. Ability to work under deadlines and heavy workloads. Skill and ability across multiple business intelligence tool sets (e.g. SAS, IBM, and Microsoft). Ability to work with all levels of healthcare personnel from senior leadership to entry level personnel across the enterprise. Ability to take part in development of strategies and interventions to affect cost and quality. Ability to identify trends and produce forecasts. Strong interpersonal and relationship-building skills with proven ability to initiate and develop productive collaborative partnerships. Ability to drive/travel to multiple locations/facilities as needed.
It is the responsibility of every Novant Health team member to deliver the most remarkable patient experience in every dimension, every time.
Our team members are part of an environment that fosters team work, team member engagement and community involvement.
The successful team member has a commitment to leveraging diversity and inclusion in support of quality care.
All Novant Health team members are responsible for fostering a safe patient environment driven by the principles of "First Do No Harm"

name: Entry Level Program Manager
description:
Job Description
We were founded to provide growing businesses with the promotional reach they need. Our event-based approach fills that need, generating noteworthy market share growth and more customers than ever before. Brands small and large succeed when we help them reach their growth goals.

Here, we are experts when it comes to brand growth. Our talented team members build event-based promotions from scratch. For the duration of each campaign, we enhance the buying experience to deliver record-breaking conversion rates. Having promoted global firms and local startups across various industries, we’ve acquired the flexibility to meet even the most unique needs. It all comes down to empowerment – we motivate, we accelerate, and we climb together.

We are now offering Entry-Level positions for program managers in the local area. This position would work closely with Strategic Marketing Managers to identify and develop new streams of revenue for clients through exclusive advertising strategies including sales, promotions, and innovative marketing solutions. The Entry Level Program Manager would create and execute these campaigns and convey the promotions to each respective target market within a dynamic team environment.

Marketing opportunity for revenue

Entry Level Program Managers will work in the following areas:
Customer Acquisition and Retention

Territory Management
Program Management requirements:
College degree or relevant work experience preferred
Sales and/or marketing experience a plus, but not a requirement.
Competitive and proactive attitude
Confident demeanor.
Strong student mentality
Excellent work ethic

name: Business Systems Analyst
description:
General Function

Wolverine Worldwide is a global marketer of branded footwear, apparel, and accessories. With an established global footprint that spans approximately 200 countries and territories, as well as a rock-solid infrastructure, Wolverine Worldwide is dedicated to advancing the following brands that comprise the ever-expanding portfolio: Bates, Chaco, Cat Footwear, Harley Davidson Footwear, Hush Puppies, Keds, Merrell, Saucony, Sperry, and Wolverine. Wolverine Worldwide’s continued success is driven by our ability to stay true to our simple mission: we empower, engage and inspire our consumers – every step of the way.

Support business applications, including maintenance, new development and problem solving to provide the company with a reliable set of business applications designed to facilitate the information needs of the various business units.

Writes and modifies software codes to meet business requirements; creates and executes test plans for software modifications and facilitates transfer into production; writes software documentation suitable for internal systems control and user manuals.
Confers with customers and team members to determine requirements; design business application systems that address and solve corporate business needs.
Estimates and costs system development efforts.
Leads and/or assists team members and customers with problem solving related to software application performance and usage.
Participates and supports disaster recovery initiatives and change management standards and procedures.
Maintains awareness of current technologies and technological trends; assimilates new technology into company work environment.
Provides rotational on call support, including evenings and weekends.
Performs duties consistent with the company’s AAP/EEO goals and policies.
Performs other duties as required/assigned by manager.

Bachelor’s degree in Computer Science or a related field or equivalent work experience.

Strong analytical, problem solving and organizational skills; ability to operate independently or as part of a team.
Ability to establish and maintain effective working relationships.
Good oral and written communication skills.
WORKING CONDITIONSNormal office environment. Some travel required.

Job Description:
Job Details

Title: Business Systems Analyst, Advanced Entry - PeopleSoft HCM Human Resources

Job Category: Staff

Description:
This is an entry level professional position involving project and end user support of administrative information systems within a group of Business Systems Analysts responsible for ensuring that service goals and objectives are accomplished within prescribed time parameters, within budget, while taking a holistic approach to the integration of the applications. The role of this position is production and project support and planning activities that are aligned with strategic and operational improvements and initiatives.

Under the general supervision of the Manager of the application area and in coordination with the lead analyst, the employee will interpret and respond to user problems related to information systems as the subject matter expert (SME) and perform project task assignments. The employee will work closely with technical and managerial staff to develop and improve support procedures and ensure specific project goals are accomplished as a team. The employee initiates and owns project improvement initiatives, production support, and project related tasks within their functional area of expertise.

Tasks are varied in nature and often time critical. The customer base and the service environment are complex. Identification of and adherence to IT best practices and standard operating procedures for service area are important, however, flexibility in meeting the needs of customers is also a key consideration. Data-based decision making is expected.

Essential Duties and Responsibilities include:
Serve as primary SME, providing functional support to end users on the Human Resources and Managed Faculty Events modules within the PeopleSoft Human Capital Management (HCM) System.
Serve as backup support analyst providing functional support to end users on multiple modules within core application systems.
Work with other subject matter experts to support the integration of various application systems between multiple core application systems.
Troubleshoot and resolve application issues requiring high level business expertise.
Assist in the analysis of requirements, design and development of solutions to meet business requirements.
Participate in the documentation of functional requirements, system design specifications, use cases, workflow diagrams, and interface designs.
Work closely with senior Business Systems Analyst to assist in the development of custom solutions and fixes.
Provide 24/7 on-call rotational support of applications.
Participate in the implementation of appropriate testing strategy, and prepare resulting test cases and scenarios.
Perform system testing and assist with Institutional constituents in user acceptance testing as applicable.
Support change control process and associated tools to fully document and manage application changes.
Provide content and identify areas that require change for end user documentation (i.e. Business Process, training, Known issues, release notes, etc.).
Ensure requirements are defined for any changes.
Analyze impact of changes and resolve any conflicts.
Document modifications and work with technical analysts to deliver application program modifications and improvements to end users.
Participate in upgrade, patch and fix analysis and system testing.
Provide end user training.
Participate and lead inter/intra departmental business process improvement initiatives.
Attend relevant training seminars as permitted by workload and budget constraints.
Participate in organization or system-provided training regarding changes in administrative services law, rules, and regulations.
Other duties as assigned.

Required Qualifications:
EDUCATION AND EXPERIENCE REQUIRED:
Baccalaureate degree required.
Over one year of related experience required.
Or equivalent combination of education and experience.
KNOWLEDGE, SKILLS AND ABILITIES REQUIRED:
Knowledge of relational database management systems.
Knowledge of process improvement principles.
Knowledge of project management principles.
Knowledge of software development lifecycles and approaches.
Knowledge of functionality testing procedures.
Knowledge of end user training and support principles.
Skill in collaborating with multiple constituents.
Skill in decision making and problem solving.
Skill in the provision of support to end users.
Skill in oral and written communication.
Ability to respond diplomatically to sensitive and critical issues.
Ability to effectively multi-task.

Desired Qualifications:
Strongly Preferred:
Bachelor's degree or equivalent and a minimum of 2-3 years related work experience and/or training in a business related field; or equivalent combination of education and experience.

name: Entry Level Project Manager
description:
Chicago-based EZLinks Golf LLC, a PGA TOUR affiliated company, provides leading technology and services to the golf industry including tee sheets, point of sale, and reservation services, with a focus on driving rounds of golf. EZLinks also powers TeeOff.com by PGA TOUR, a leading online retail site, helping golfers book tee times at more than 3,000 courses worldwide.

EZLinks offers a dynamic and casual environment, competitive benefits, and a chance to change the golf industry.

Key Responsibilities:
EZLinks Golf is seeking an Entry Level Project Manager to join our Implementation team in our Chicago, IL or Richmond, VA office.

· Working with new and existing clients to develop project plans, timelines, and milestones regarding new software implementation and training.

· Collaborating with internal and external stakeholders to manage changes in project scope, identify risks, and handle crises.

· Working with and scheduling Implementation Consultants to identify needs and deliver excellent service to clients.

· Equipment evaluation, procurement, configuration and logistics.

· Creating and documenting processes as departmental needs evolve.

Qualifications:

· Detail oriented with strong teamwork and communication skills.

· Working Knowledge of Salesforce and Basecamp a plus.

· Motivated self-starter with the ability to manage, remotely and concurrently, software implementations at multiple client sites.

· Previous experience with the EZLinks / IBS software suite (or other electronic reservation/POS systems) is highly desirable.

· Ability to travel up to 10% of the time.

Experience:

· Bachelor's degree and/or 2+ years of software implementation and project management experience.

· Software implementation experience is preferred.

· Working knowledge of the hospitality, accounting, and/or golf industry is desirable.Previous experience with the EZLinks / IBS software suite (or other electronic reservation/POS systems) is highly desirable.

Why should you work for EZLinks?

At EZLinks, we offer competitive base salaries and generous bonus opportunities to reward performance. Full-time employees have the opportunity to participate in our comprehensive benefits package including medical, dental, vision, basic and voluntary life and AD&D, discount programs, paid vacation, and 401K.

No agencies please.

EZLinks Golf LLC is an Equal Opportunity Employer

name: Heavy Lift Project Manager - Louisiana
description:
Job Description
Mammoet is looking for an entry level Heavy Lift Project Manager for two different branch locations, one located in Westlake Louisiana and one located in St. Gabriel, Louisiana.

Mammoet USA Inc is global industry leader in logistics whose employees give their best every day and truly make a difference in projects all over the world. Mammoet helps clients improve construction efficiency and reduce downtime of plants and installations. For that purpose, we provide solutions for lifting, transporting, installing and decommissioning large and heavy structures.

Job Description:

Responsible for defining, implementing and monitoring the Projects strategy and policies for the Region as cost efficient as possible, taking into account the local environment and legislation, in order to achieve operational excellence against service and process quality standards.

Responsibilities (including but not limited to)
Conduct all business in a professional, respectful manner.
Reviews requirements and work of awarded projects and develops execution plan for the project.
Acts as the single point of contact between Mammoet and the client.
Responsible for the successful execution of the project in accordance with how the project was sold.
Monitors and controls project schedule.
Ensures project invoicing is timely, accurate and in accordance with contract invoicing guidelines.
Ensures project has required personnel, with appropriate experience and/or training for the required tasks.
Ensures and assumes responsibility for the safe execution of the project as outlined in the Mammoet SHE-Q Manual and as per client requirements.
Delegates and coordinates all onsite activities to meet set goals for the project.
Monitors and is accountable for the project budget throughout the execution of the project.
Monitors and controls any Contract Change Notices for extra work, omissions or any other potential changes to the contract whilst ensuring that Mammoet receives fair treatment in regards to such changes.
Disciplines include all facets of Mammoet activity on site as Mammoet makes no distinction between internal divisions, branches, unions, contracts or other on a project. We strive to portray a single Mammoet unit in regards to meeting client requirements and expectations.
Ability to travel internationally.
Skills
Lead, supervise and control the whole project chain (from contract management, planning, execution, budgeting and forecasting, close out)
Ensure optimal services in-external
Support and guide engineering on equipment and applied methods
Read, understand and follow engineered drawing and blueprints
Education and Experience
Bachelor’s Degree in technical or operations related discipline preferred.
Intermediate to advance computer skills: Microsoft Project, Microsoft Office (Excel), Auto-CAD, and SAP.
8-10 years of progressive field and/or project management experience in a related industry.
Strong working knowledge of the crane and transport industry.
5+ years of experience leading teams of 20 people or more.
Proven communication skills and ability to influence others.
5+ years of commercial or contract experience.

Company Description
Mammoet helps clients improve construction efficiency and optimize the uptime of plants and installations. For that purpose, we provide solutions for lifting, transporting, installing and decommissioning large and heavy structures.

Our services are focused on the petrochemical and mining industries, civil engineering, power generation and offshore projects. The logistic challenges in these industries are growing daily. Factors such as remote locations, harsh climates and a strong emphasis on the environment are constantly driving us towards smarter and safer solutions.

We provide the following services:

Heavy Lifting Services
Heavy Transport Services
Plant Turnaround / Shutdown Management
Site-wide Construction Services
Modular Construction
Factory-to-Foundation / Logistics
Emergency response & Wreck removal
Decommissioning of onshore and offshore installations
Trading in new and used equipment worldwide

For over two hundred years, we’ve been known for the unique capability of our state-of-the-art equipment. But it’s the trust of our clients that has brought us where we are today. Their confidence inspires 5,000 Mammoet professionals to give it their all each day and truly make a difference in projects all over the world.

Mammoet USA South, Inc. is an equal employment opportunity employer and makes all employment related decisions on the basis of qualification to perform the job requirements. Mammoet USA South, Inc. treats all employees and applicants equally, without regard to race, color, national origin, religion, age, sex, sexual orientation, handicap, disability, veteran status, genetic information, and/or any other status or condition protected by law, except where a bona fide occupational qualification exists. All candidates for employment must fully complete, date, and sign the standard Mammoet USA South, Inc. employment application form. Employment at Mammoet USA South, Inc. is on an “at will” basis.

name: Program Manager I
description:
Shall be responsible for the successful cost, schedule and performance of the contract. Serves as the main point of contact for the Contracting Officer, the Contracting Officers Representative, the Government Program Manager and the Contractors senior management. Directly contributes to program efforts in several areas, including cost management/avoidance, schedule estimation and tracking, contract performance management, risk management, requirements analysis and quality assurance activities. Ensures proper performance of tasks necessary to ensure the most efficient and effective execution of the contract. Will utilize expert communication skills needed to direct the skilled technical resources and report on the technical progress, issues and problem areas, as well as write and review technical documents.

Works with the higher-level program manager, if applicable, to provide effective and efficient management of the Contractors effort

Allocates resources (staffing, facilities and budgets) on the contract

Reviews and proposes the Integrated Program Baseline (or resource loaded schedule) to the Government

Reviews and approves all earned value, Estimate To Complete, Funds and Man-hour Expenditure Reports, or other financial reports, as appropriate

Reviews risk and risk mitigation activities and allocates budgets for the same

Prepares program status reviews and other formal reviews to be presented to the Government PM

Reviews and allocates management reserve within contractual limits

Ensures the timely recruitment and training of program staff both direct and indirect

Reviews all financial and technical reports before release to the Government

Ensures cross-discipline integration within the contract to meet the Governments needs

Communicates issues and solutions to the Government PM in a timely and transparent manner

Ensures compliance with all regulatory and administrative requirements imposed by the contract in coordination with the Contractors contracts staff

Qualifications:

Five (5) years of experience managing program and contracts of similar scope, type and complexity within the Federal government. Shall have either a PMP certification, FAC-P/PM Entry Level or DAWIA Level 1 certification in Program Management. Shall be knowledgeable of the guidelines provided by the Federal Acquisition Regulation (FAR) and Defense Federal Acquisition Regulation (DFAR), DoD 5000 series and Intelligence Community Directive (ICD) 801 policies. Must have at least one (1) year of demonstrated experience in conducting requirements analysis, resource allocation, project costing, deliverable tracking, schedule and financial data monitoring and reporting.

Clearance: Top Secret w/poly

name: Assistant Project Manager
description:
Job Reference: G4S/TP/3742188/135059
Number of Positions: 1
Job Category: Security/Protective Services
Contract Type: Full Time
Salary: $50,000.00

Location:
Brookfield, Wisconsin
G4S Region:
North America
Country:United States

G4S Business Unit:US Secure Solutions
Closing Date: December 26, 2018

Job Introduction:

** $500 Sign-On Bonus ** (current security licensees only)! **

PLEASE CLICK APPLY OR TEXT "JOBS" TO 561-660-9797 FROM YOUR SMARTPHONE!

The world's leading private security organization, G4S, has an immediate job opportunity for an Assistant Project Manager. The Assistant Project Manager is responsible for the day-to-day operations of assigned client facilities. Generally, the Assistant Project Manager will provide support to the Project Manager, and shift supervisors, and ensure contract compliance by regularly inspecting and auditing each facility assigned to the area as well as ensuring appropriate staffing.

G4S is a security provider for the United States government, fortune 500 companies, nuclear power plants, oil and gas companies, airport, ports, banks, hospitals, factories, warehouses, commercial facilities, residential communities and much more.

G4S offers job security, excellent pay and benefits, and career opportunities. We offer entry level careers, management careers, sales careers and executive careers across the United States and internationally.

** $500 bonus payable after 180 days of continuous employment. Bonus amount is subject to applicable federal and state income withholdings.**

Role Responsibility:

Specific Duties and Essential Functions
Assist Project Manager with administrative duties such as payroll, scheduling, filing of paperwork, and maintaining files.
Perform classroom and field training for new hires, and ongoing training to the current security team at the direction of the Project Manager.
General Human Resources management; participate in selection and placement, conduct performance reviews, manage attendance, and conflict resolution; scheduling; as required.
Review alarm system open/close reports, compile exception reports and forward to appropriate security manager/operations manager for review;
Provide monthly report to the facilities and corporate security organizations detailing all pertinent activities that have occurred in the previous month concerning any security and safety issues
Act as the Site Supervisor when a Shift Lead is not present, deal with day to day operations and officer management.
Assist the Project Manager in event coordination, set up, and execution of the security plan.
Ensures the correct and consistent administration of the client contract
Assist the PM with Human Resource issues and investigations at the direction of the Branch HR Manager.
Perform random unscheduled inspections of the security team.
Create and execute the security plan and procedure for major and minor events
The Ideal Candidate:

Education, Licenses and Certifications Required
Must possess a high school diploma or equivalent
Must be licensed as an unarmed or armed security officer in the State of Wisconsin
Type and Length of Specific Experience Required
Must possess a minimum of 3 years of security-related experience in a supervisory capacity in either security, law enforcement, and/or military
Skills Required
Proficient computer skills including Microsoft Office
Effective oral and written communication skills
Active listening skills
Ability to assess and evaluate situations effectively
Ability to identify critical issues quickly and accurately
Attention to detail
Other
Must be at least 18 years old or the minimum age required by the state, if higher
Must be a U.S. citizen or a foreign citizen authorized to legally work in the United States
Subject to a drug screen to the extent permitted by law
Must be able to provide, upon job offer, a DD214 discharge document with discharge status indicated, if prior military
Physical Requirements and Environment

Environment: Office, building exterior; some exposure to extreme temperatures may be necessary

Major activity: Working on PC while sitting; telephone use

Physical efforts to carry out job duties: Limited, to include some standing, bending, limited stretching and reaching

About the Company:

EOE Minority/Female/Disabled/Veteran/Sexual Orientation/Gender Identity

G4S is an Equal Opportunity/Affirmative Action Employer
and an Alcohol- and Drug-Free Workplace

If you have any questions regarding Equal Employment Opportunity, Affirmative Action or Diversity and Inclusion, or have difficulty using the online system and require an alternate method to apply, please contact our Corporate Human Resources Department at (800) 506-6265.

To receive an update on your application status, please contact our local office by following this link: http://g4s.us/en/Contact-Us/Local-Offices

name: Business Analyst
description:
Client and Position details:
Client: State of Arizona - Arizona Department of Education (AZED)
Job title: Business Analyst (Job ID: 56913)
Location: 1535 W. Jefferson St, Phoenix, AZ
Duration: 9 Months (strong possibility for an extension)
Interview: In-Person Only
*Please do not submit any candidates who have been submitted to a similar role at AZED in the past 6 months. **
Business Analyst
Imagine designing world-class online educational experiences for hundreds of thousands of K-12 students, teachers, parents, and school staff in Arizona. The Arizona Department of Education is creating award-winning educational web applications and you can contribute to our success by crafting the very best user interfaces using the bleeding-edge web technologies.

Position Summary
The business analyst's primary objective is helping businesses implement technology solutions in a cost-effective way by determining the requirements of a project or program, and communicating them clearly to stakeholders, facilitators and partners.

Responsibilities
Understand what the business does and how it is accomplished and key process dependencies that may exist
Analyze business functional requirements to identify information, procedures and decision flows
Assist in identifying scope of work
Elicit requirements and document in either a Business Requirements Document format or, as Agile Backlog Items
Prepare business process maps and high-level work flows
Create the following documents: Use Cases, Functional Specification, Wireframes, and Report Mock-ups
Develop Agile Product Backlog items for presentation to development teams and business owners including appropriate assumptions, acceptance criteria, User details, and non-functional requirements
Identify business processes for redesign; Determine how to improve existing business process; Identify modifications to automated processes
Identify complex requirements across systems and business domains
Understand the integration of processes across domains, scope, charter, plans
Ability to communicate technical information to a non-technical audience; communication of business information to a technical audience
Co-ordinate testing efforts with Quality Assurance
Performs other duties as assigned or apparent
Requirements
Bachelor's degree in Computer Science, Information Technology, or related field preferred; Master's degree preferred
Minimum of 4 years' practical experience in business analysis required
Minimum of 3 years' experience in scrum/agile environments; Scrum certification preferred
Experience gathering requirements from the client/business and documenting.
Experience with process improvement, workflow, benchmarking and / or evaluation of business processes required
Intermediate level of proficiency with PC based software programs and automated database management systems required (Excel, Access, PowerPoint) required.
Ability to communicate analysis including trends and opportunities to clients and the business in writing and verbally required
Ability to problem solve including multiple priorities and research conflicting and/or inaccurate data as required.
Working knowledge of relational databases, database structures is required.
Knowledge of current Microsoft .NET technologies including C#, VB.NET, ASP.Net, and SharePoint highly preferred.
Working knowledge of Team Foundation Services 2013 preferred.
Strong aspiration to learn new technologies.
Demonstrated ability to use discretion, make sound decisions, and maintain confidentiality.
Proven strong relationship-building and communication skills with team members and business users.
Ability to work with a minimal amount of direction while being pro-active in keeping their management informed of project related issues.
Ability to respectfully question ideas and share a point of view with others in support of the business requirements and needs
Ability to effectively communicate with various levels of employees ranging from entry level to senior leadership.
Ability to manage multiple projects at the same time and shift priorities quickly.
Experience working on an Agile/Scrum team preferred
Proven strong problem-solving skills, troubleshooting,
Waiting for your prompt and positive response. Thank you.

name: Business Analyst Intern (Temporary) - Administration
description:
The Business Analyst Intern responsibilities will include assisting in projects and assignments related to revenue integrity analysis and financial planning and may include, but are not limited to: [1] Assisting in compiling data for construction of the annual operating budget; [2] preparing and tracking claims reviewed by insurance; [3] tracking denied claims for follow-up activity; [4] the development and distribution of monthly physician practice financial packets; [5] the production of an insurance contract comprehensive tracking sheet; [6] market share and referral pattern analysis; [7] the production and distribution of contract labor reports; and [8] other ad-hoc analysis. This position requires strong communication skills, analytical skills and advanced Excel skills.

Froedtert South is more than a place to work; it's a place to build a career.

Education: High School or Equivalent (GED)
Experience: Entry Level
Knowledge, Skills and Abilities required:
Competency in Microsoft Office Suite (Word, Excel, PowerPoint, Outlook, etc.).
Ability to think critically and act independently.
Ability to meet deadlines.
Self-motivating and driven to complete tasks at hand.
Excellent time management skills.
Accuracy and attention to detail.

Shift: Days
Hours: 0-20
FTE: 0-0.2
Location: Kenosha Medical Center

Froedtert South is a comprehensive regional healthcare system that has served southeastern Wisconsin and northern Illinois communities for more than 100 years. Froedtert South provides services primarily through the Kenosha Medical Center Campus and the St. Catherine’s Medical Center Campus and several other clinic locations.

Froedtert South is an Equal Opportunity Employer. name: Business Systems Analyst, Senior - PeopleSoft HCM Applications Integrations
description:
Position ID: 41585

Hide Location
Institution:
Board of Regents
College/Div/School:
University System of Georgia
Department:
Human Capital Management (HCM) Operations
Branch Campus:
Athens, Georgia

Hide Position Description
New Position?:
Yes
Job Class:
Systems Analyst, Senior
Job Description:
Job Details

Title: Business Systems Analyst, Senior - PeopleSoft HCM Applications Integrations

Job Category: Staff

Description:
Under general supervision of the Manager of the application area, coordinates and leads the activities of a group of subject matter experts (SME) for life-cycle enhancement and support of a number of projects associated with the delivery of a supported application service and its integration with other enterprise applications. The position generally possesses authority to coordinate work of the "Business Systems Analyst" and "Business Systems Analyst Entry Level" positions and instruct respective positions in specific techniques or technical methods for accomplishing work assignments or projects.

The position may serve as project leader on special projects and works with the management team and other team members to develop common standards and procedures for program and data maintenance and enhancements of the assigned projects, including quality assurance and testing procedures. Tasks are varied in nature and often time critical. The customer base and the service environment are complex. Identification of and adherence to IT best practices and standard operating procedures for service area are important, however, flexibility in meeting the needs of customers is also a key consideration. Data-based decision making is expected.

The selected candidate for this position will typically:
Guide, advise, coordinate and assist in prioritization of team member efforts.
Provide extended functional and technical support to multiple Administrative Services projects.
Analyze complex or previously unknown application issues requiring high-level business expertise and analysis.
Analyze requirements, design and assist in development of solutions to meet business requirements.
Document functional requirements, system design specifications, use cases, workflow diagrams, and interface designs.
Provide 24/7 on-call rotational support of applications.
Coordinate the development of custom solutions, fixes, patches and security.
Coordinate and implement testing strategy, system testing and lead institutional constituents in user acceptance testing.
Recommend and support enhancements to change control process and associated tools to fully document and manage application changes.
Review, provide content and identify areas that require change for end user documentation (i.e. Business Process, training, Known issues, release notes, etc.).
Provide end user and team training.
Facilitate inter/intra departmental task and communication.
Participate and lead inter/intra departmental business process improvement initiatives.
Collaborate with stakeholders to ensure that supporting application and system changes and updates are implemented correctly and any integration issues are addressed and discussed with management in a timely manner.
Understand interdependencies within application module and components.
Understand integration points and interdependencies of administrative applications and supporting systems.
Mentor team members to enhance technical and functional skills of team.
Create and submit weekly status reports.
Other duties as assigned.

Required Qualifications:
EDUCATION AND EXPERIENCE REQUIRED:
Baccalaureate degree required.
Over five years of related experience required.
Or equivalent combination of education and experience.
KNOWLEDGE, SKILLS AND ABILITIES REQUIRED:
Knowledge of USG business procedures.
Knowledge of relational database management systems.
Knowledge of process improvement principles.
Knowledge of project management principles.
Knowledge of software development lifecycles and approaches
Knowledge of functionality testing procedures.
Knowledge of data analysis, analytics, business intelligence and programming.
Knowledge of end user training and support principles.
Knowledge of Board of Regents policies and procedures.
Skill in collaborating with multiple constituents.
Skill in decision making and problem solving.
Skill in the provision of support to end users.
Skill in oral and written communication.
Ability to respond diplomatically to sensitive and critical issues.
Ability to effectively multi-task.

Desired Qualifications:
Strongly Preferred:
A Bachelor’s Degree in a related field and at least six (6) years job related experience or any equivalent combination of education and experience
Minimum of five (5) years of experience in working with a complex human resources information system or payroll application from a functional perspective
Ability to comfortably work in a fast paced, often ambiguous and event driven environment
Solid understanding and progressive work experience as a functional analyst supporting a complex human resources information system
Minimum of three (3) years current, hands-on experience working with an integrated third party solution
System application upgrade and implementation experience
Ability to analyze SQL scripts that will be run against the Oracle database
Ability to explain functional concepts to the business Stakeholders
Ability to work with diverse groups within the University System
Ability to work with customers in gathering requirements

Posting Department: 7311000 - HCM Operations

Regular/Temporary: Regular

Minimum Hiring Salary: $67,125

name: MS Associate Business Analyst
description:
Overview

Welcome to Allscripts! Our Mission is to be the most trusted provider of innovative solutions that empower all stakeholders across the healthcare continuum to deliver world-class outcomes. Our Vision is a Connected Community of Health that spans continents and borders. With the largest community of clients in healthcare, Allscripts is able to deliver an integrated platform of clinical, financial, connectivity and information solutions to facilitate enhanced collaboration and exchange of critical patient information.

The primary purpose of this role is to be responsible for creating the business and/or functional requirements necessary for technology solutions that meet customer needs, expected delivery dates, and exceptional quality standards. This is a client facing role based at St. Clair Hospital in Pittsburgh, PA.

Responsibilities
Work under the direction of the Manager to provide application solutions for assigned business areas.
Possess functional knowledge of assigned application technology.
Interact with business users to understand new business requirements and enhancement requests
Serve liaison role between application technology vendors, internal IS groups, and business users.
Translate business requirements into product-specific designs and configuration, detailed requirement specifications and use cases.
Assist in developing functional specifications, design documents, business process workflow and related documentation for new development projects and/or enhancement and modification requests to be used by Systems Analyst.
Interact with Systems Analysts during the software build and/or configuration process and testing process.
Perform functional application configuration and configure /run reports at user request.
Assist in designing and execution of functional, integration, and regression test plans for new application functionality, product releases and enhancement and regulatory modifications using business scenarios and use cases.
Ensure programs meet business specifications.
Demonstrate new functionality to business users seeking inputs on future direction.
Review vendor provided documentation and user manuals needed to support the product.
Directly interface with business users by responding to support calls escalated by the Service Desk.
Participate in user focus groups and requirements workshops, vendor training and demonstrations.
Assist in supporting activations and rollouts.
Consistent efforts to deliver quality solutions as per agreed scope.
Customer focus and close alignment with the customers' business objectives.
Ensure efforts to continually improve domain knowledge.
Ensure the quality of the deliverables as per the defined defects standards
Document issues with resolutions and share with team members to improve team productivity.
Provide data to generate team performance metrics.
Knowledge transfer with other team members to improve overall team education level
Take complete ownership for the assigned task and timely inform the progress of the project / task to all stakeholders.
Adherence to the defined standards.
Take initiative and drives to bring to logical conclusion; proactive approach.
Provide accurate and timely information and escalates when there are issues.
Actively participate in meetings and make valuable contribution.
Qualifications

Academic and Professional Qualifications:
BA or BS degree preferred or other relevant combination of training and experience.
Experience:
Up to 2 years entry level to moderate experience in providing support and maintenance in assigned product preferred
Excellent client facing skills, self-directed and the ability to thrive in a fast paced, highly critical environment.
Appropriate healthcare background
Clinical application experience preferred
Travel Requirements:
May require local travel
May require other travel for business needs
Working Arrangements:
May require after hours on call support
Work is performed in a standard office environment with minimal exposure to health or safety hazards
At Allscripts, our greatest strength comes from bringing together talented people with diverse perspectives to support the technology needs of 180,000 physicians, 1,500 hospitals and 10,000 post-acute organizations across the globe. Allscripts offers a competitive total rewards package, including holidays, vacation, and medical, disability and life insurance.

Allscripts' policy is to provide equal employment opportunity and affirmative action in all of its employment practices without regard to race, color, religion, sex, national origin, ancestry, marital status, protected veteran status, age, individuals with disabilities, sexual orientation or gender identity or expression or any other legally protected category. Applicants for North American based positions with Allscripts must be legally authorized to work in the United States or Canada. Verification of employment eligibility will be required as a condition of hire.
