IT Storage and Backup Project Manager

Company The Boeing Company Job ID ********** Date posted 11/26/2018
Location North Charleston South Carolina United States

Job Description

Seeking a highly motivated, positive self-starter with excellent people, communication, and organizational skills and has a successful track record as an IT Project Manager.

In this role, the successful candidate will lead others and oversee all phases of internal, cross organizational, and/or enterprise-wide projects within the Storage and Backup Services (SBS) Project Management Office. In addition to overall direction and oversight of the Storage and Backup Service PMO, the successful candidate will be responsible for leading high priority projects and some of which will have a peer project manager from the storage & backup vendor. This will require demonstrated proficiency in all, core project management areas in accordance with accepted project management standards (PMBOK, AD & S, Agile, Scaled Agile Framework).

The successful candidate will identify key stakeholder project objectives and requirements, while ensuring assigned individuals are executing the identified and assigned tasks and providing appropriate tracking and reporting per plan as well as authorize baseline plans and revisions. Project communication and executive summaries are a key job responsibility.

Your duties will include (but are not limited to):

- Build strong relationships across multiple functions to bring people together around a common goal.
- Partner with Storage and Backup Services (SBS) Management and Service Owners to develop and execute project/process plans, policies, and procedures while setting operational goals.
- Consulting with executive leadership and integrate organizational strategy and company initiatives within project deliverables.
- Drive the technical, quality, cost and schedule performance of multiple projects (most of which are Storage and Backup Services driven projects).
- Detailed management oversight of project teams conducting requirements analysis, deliverable tracking, schedule, risks/opportunities, and reporting.
- Analyze integrated project data for an understanding of project impact risks (e.g. trade-offs, among cost, schedule, quality) and advises decision makers on course of action. Balances risks with identification of opportunities and issues to represent a true RIO.
- Lead process improvements.
- Develop and maintain relationships and

name: Business Analyst
description:
EHS Technologies seeks qualified candidates for a Business Analyst position in Philadelphia, PA. Candidate should have extensive experience and knowledge with:

This is not an entry level position.

The candidate should have at least one year experience with NMCI, using NET, and supporting an ACTR.

The candidate should have a technical or business degree.

Budgeting and Analysis of over 25,000 individual CLINs.

-Summarize Division NMCI Cost for current Fiscal Year. Prepare budget based on current year and expected expansion.

-Show projected Fiscal Year NMCI costs. Work with ACTR on identifying new CLINS and identifying annual differential between CLINs that have rolled over and those that have not rolled, and determine why the non-rolled CLINs did not roll.

-Support the ACTR in preparing, entering, and analyzing the new Fiscal Year order and additional orders through the year.

NMCI Financial Processing

- Learn the process of and back up the government lead in processing NMCI orders from initial request through processing through the finance department and tracking progress through ERP. Will interface with the ACTRs, NAVSEA, and financial department staff.

- Compare NMCI invoices in eMarketplace with materials ordered in NET and actually delivered by HP. Provide summary analysis to ACTR so that ACTR can approve invoices based on data substantiated by the contractor.

ACTR Support

- Support ACTR Seat Refresh duties.

- Manage the ACTR's Seat Resource Center: Acceptance of incoming orders, tracking the inventory of workstations, peripherals, and supplies; issuing hardware from and receiving hardware returns; and notifying the ACTR when additional materials are required.

- Perform NMCI MACs - Seat Moves, Seat conversions NNPI, Peripheral Moves, Functional Mailbox creation, Functional Account creations, Distribution List creations and updates, Fileshare creation, and Bulk share creation.

- Perform Account Processing - NMCI Account Creation (NIPR, SIPR, DEV, NNPI), NMCI Account Deactivation, (NIPR, SIPR, DEV, NNPI), NMCI Account transfers, SAAR processing.

- Perform NET Corrections - Update NET records, edit / update user profiles.

- Perform Global Address List (GAL) Updates.

- Perform eMarketplace Task Order MODs - Work with NAVSEA and Comptroller to process and track NMCI Task orders modifications.

US CITIZENSHIP, DoD SECRET SECURITY CLEARANCE REQUIRED

EHS Technologies Corporation is an Affirmative Action/Equal Opportunity Employer

name: Project Manager
description:
BELFOR:

RESTORING MORE THAN PROPERTY

Flooding. Fires. Windstorms. Hundreds of thousands of clients rely on BELFOR Property Restoration each year to rebuild their lives, homes, and businesses. We're Restoring More Than Property.

With BELFOR specialists in every major metropolitan area in the USA ready to respond 24/7/365, we provide the fastest, highest quality service that's unmatched in the industry.

The right response team can mean the difference between recovery and total loss. In the midst of chaos, you need an experienced company with a proven track record and solid relationships with leading insurance providers.

BELFOR is looking for qualified candidates for the following position. BELFOR team members are a unique breed, committed to restoring not only property, but restoring lives for those affected by disasters, large or small.

Position Overview:
BELFOR Project Managers have either a restoration or construction focus. Candidates for the entry level superintendent position must have sufficient relevant training and experience pursuant to listed competencies in their focus area. Successful superintendent candidates may qualify through internal tenure with one or more BELFOR technician tracks of fire, water and contents or through tenure with the BELFOR carpentry Track. External candidates may qualify through relevant experience in the restoration, cleaning, and/or construction industries. This is the first phase of the Project Manager path for new hires, you will quickly move to the next phase upon completion of New Hire training.

Responsibilities
Superintendents assigned TPA program work must know all program requirements as well as Xactimate estimates and budgets.
Construction track -- must understand scope, schedule work, communicate professionally, ensure project safety, and maintain quality control
Establish their core project management capabilities while at this level. Critical skills include time management, budgeting, scheduling, site supervision, customer contact, communication, quality control, safety, documentation, and change orders
Must continually advance their knowledge of current and past construction practices
Review daily requirements of the projects, document progress and notify managers of progress and challenges
Provide appropriate field documentation, photo logs, graphs and sketches for various TPA projects
Must be able to perform all skills related to prior Intermediate Fire Damage Specialist, intermediate Water Damage Specialist, Intermediate Carpenter roles.
Perform Daily vehicle safety and maintenance inspections and maintain in clean serviceable condition
Must maintain attention to detail
Will be required to meet BELFOR Standards in safeguarding other people's property
Must have a comprehensive understanding of customer service, principles and practices
Work under time constraints to meet specific timelines
Will be required to work nights and weekends as requested and travel periodically
Report time worked and equipment and consumables used timely and accurately
Attend BELFOR sponsored operations and safety training courses as required


Duties:
Supervise and self-perform residential and light commercial work
Continue training until they demonstrate ability to complete projects on time and on budget with documented customer satisfaction
Construction focus -- plan, coordinate, and oversee employees and subcontractors in all phases of work
Read and manage blue prints
Responsible for projects up to $150K
Understand and adhere to local building codes and regulatory agencies
Restoration focus -- direct small crews of BELFOR personnel and temporary workers
Responsible for projects up to $50K
Attend BELFOR approved training courses in areas of lesser experience.
Supervise multiple crews simultaneously on multiple projects
Select appropriate disposal options and get release of liability for disposed items
Disclaimer
The statements herein are intended to describe the general nature and level of work being performed by employees, and are not to be construed as an exhaustive list of responsibilities, duties and skills required of personnel so classified.

Qualifications:
Carry current IICRC ASD designation for Water Damage related work
Certified to operate a Hi-Lo fork lift
Complete previous 18 months as Intermediate Water Damage Specialist, intermediate Carpentry, or Intermediate Fire Damage Specialist or have similar industry experience
Eligible to operate a motor vehicle per BELFOR's vehicle policy
Possess sense of urgency, professional demeanor, positive attitude, and strong work ethic
English language literacy and fluency
Physical Demands
Frequent lifting in excess of 50 lbs
Occasional lifting from 41 lbs +, assisted (up to 50% of the time)
Access and mobility in tight spaces
Sustained periods of standing, sitting, walking, bending, and kneeling
Ability to use mobile devices for collection of data and time.

name: Business/Systems Analyst
description:
Job Description
Candidates for this position must be US citizens capable of obtaining a DoD security clearance.

**This position is ideal for recent IT/Business Graduates and anyone that has entry level skills as a IT Business Analyst

Duties:
Provide services to our existing customers in on-going process and end user support as required
Maintain relationships with existing customers in order to assess customer satisfaction, identify potential and actual problem areas, and resolve difficulties
Participate in development strategies and plans to implement the strategies
Advise management of organizational implications of new business opportunities
Maintain contact with appropriate company personnel, other contractors and customers
This position will be required to work at customer site ( Andrews Joint Base) – up to 30% travel is required
Required Skills:
Bachelor’s degree
1-7 years of experience
Good collaboration and communication skills, both written and oral
The ability to multi-task and work independently while thriving in a team environment
Be a self-starter and results oriented
Ability to communicate information to a wide variety of technical and non-technical individuals or groups
Solid analytical and quantitative skills
Basic understanding of IT systems with experience in Business and System Analysis
Be able to transform ideas into actionable plans with team collaboration
Basic knowledge of business process analysis including flow charting, activity diagrams and workflow models
Knowledge of project planning techniques
Be willing to learn and expand skill set, embracing new technologies and techniques

Company Description
DHA, Inc. is a rapidly expanding company offering many growth opportunities in the Information Systems, Technology and Engineering, fields. We pride ourselves on providing quality products and services for customers in both the private and government sectors.

name: Project Manager
description:
Overview

Every day at Perspecta, we enable hundreds of thousands of people to take on our nation’s most important work. We’re a company founded on a diverse set of capabilities and skills, bound together by a single promise: we never stop solving our nation’s most complex challenges. Our team of engineers, analysts, developers, investigators, integrators and architects work tirelessly to create innovative solutions. We continually push ourselves—to respond, to adapt, to go further. To look ahead to the changing landscape and develop new and innovative ways to serve our customers.

Perspecta works with U.S. government customers in defense, intelligence, civilian, health care, and state and local markets. Our high-caliber employees are rewarded in many ways—not only through competitive salaries and benefits packages, but the opportunity to create a meaningful impact in jobs and on projects that matter.

Perspecta’s talented and robust workforce—14,000 strong—stands ready to welcome you to the team. Let’s make an impact together.

Perspecta is an AA/EEO Employer - Minorities/Women/Veterans/Disabled and other protected categories

Responsibilities

Responsible for the performance of relatively small technical projects or a definable portion of a larger technical program in accordance with contract requirements and company policies, procedures and guidelines. Directs and supervises all support resources for the performance of project assignments and activities. Manages the technical direction of a project through the design, implementation, and testing in accordance with project objectives. Also responsible for acquiring follow-on business associated with assigned projects and for supporting new business development by leading relatively small proposals or assisting with major proposals. Responsible for all aspects of the development and implementation of assigned projects and provides a single point of contact for those projects. Takes projects from original concept through final implementation. Interfaces with all areas affected by the project including end users, computer services, and client services. Defines project scope and objectives. Develops detailed work plans, schedules, project estimates, resource plans, and status reports. Conducts project meetings and is responsible for project tracking and analysis. Ensures adherence to quality standards and reviews project deliverables. Manages the integration of vendor tasks and tracks and reviews vendor deliverables. Provides technical and analytical guidance to project team. Recommends and takes action to direct the analysis and solutions of problems. May assist in the management of a business unit or department or is at an entry level in management of such under the close supervision of the Division or Program Director. Manages one or more programs. May supervise professional and technical personnel performing in their regular disciplines. May participate in the development and execution of budgets, sales and marketing plans and other strategic tools. Participates in driving initiatives for achieving established objectives. May serve as the primary or assistant technical and management interface for the company, customer, and senior staff. Provides management services including general administrative oversight, time accounting. financial tracking, cost projection, inventory management, personnel evaluation and support. Responsible for the preparation of and accountability for all contract deliverables. Responsible for assisting in the technical leadership and direction to a multidisciplinary staff. Develop and operate a variety of technical systems related to the specific job function. Specify systems requirements and insure that completed systems meet requirements. Support data acquisition process control. Prepares and approves Standard Operating Procedures, Protocols and other technical documentation. Able to supervise, manage, support and evaluate personnel.

Qualifications

Requires BA/BS with 10 years of experience with at least 4 years of management level responsibility. Incumbent has specialized knowledge in at least one area of expertise and a general knowledge in 1-2 other areas.

name: Senior Business Systems Analyst
description:
Primary Responsibilities:

Work with client staff in JAD sessions to understand and elaborate business requirements and functional specifications for new desired software enhancements

Document and publish business requirements and functional specifications.

Update system process flows and test case coverage matrix

Become knowledgeable in all major business functional areas of the application in order to mentor entry level personnel and support Production Operations staff in production issues

Provide business knowledge support to QA team and verify test cases constructed by QA

Work with Release Management staff as needed in support of deployments

Perform triage on all software defects identified in Production and during testing cycles

Responsible for the performance of relatively small technical projects or a definable portion of a larger technical program in accordance with contract requirements and company policies, procedures and guidelines. Directs and supervises all support resources for the performance of project assignments and activities. Manages the technical direction of a project through the design, implementation, and testing in accordance with project objectives. Also responsible for acquiring follow-on business associated with assigned projects and for supporting new business development by leading relatively small proposals or assisting with major proposals. Responsible for all aspects of the development and implementation of assigned projects and provides a single point of contact for those projects. Takes projects from original concept through final implementation. Interfaces with all areas affected by the project including end users, computer services, and client services. Defines project scope and objectives. Develops detailed work plans, schedules, project estimates, resource plans, and status reports. Conducts project meetings and is responsible for project tracking and analysis. Ensures adherence to quality standards and reviews project deliverables. Manages the integration of vendor tasks and tracks and reviews vendor deliverables. Provides technical and analytical guidance to project team. Recommends and takes action to direct the analysis and solutions of problems. May assist in the management of a business unit or department or is at an entry level in management of such under the close supervision of the Division or Program Director. Manages one or more programs. May supervise professional and technical personnel performing in their regular disciplines. May participate in the development and execution of budgets, sales and marketing plans and other strategic tools. Participates in driving initiatives for achieving established objectives. May serve as the primary or assistant technical and management interface for the company, customer, and senior staff. Provides management services including general administrative oversight, time accounting. financial tracking, cost projection, inventory management, personnel evaluation and support. Responsible for the preparation of and accountability for all contract deliverables. Responsible for assisting in the technical leadership and direction to a multidisciplinary staff. Develop and operate a variety of technical systems related to the specific job function. Specify systems requirements and insure that completed systems meet requirements. Support data acquisition process control. Prepares and approves Standard Operating Procedures, Protocols and other technical documentation. Able to supervise, manage, support and evaluate personnel.

Requires BA/BS with 10 years of experience with at least 4 years of management level responsibility. Incumbent has specialized knowledge in at least one area of expertise and a general knowledge in 1-2 other areas.

name: Project Manager with TS/SCI
description:
Founded in 1987, IMG has been a leading small business that exemplifies competence, integrity and follow-through by consistently providing customer focused professional services derived from our knowledge of the customer, understanding of the requirements, development of our approach, proposal of our solution, delivery of our offerings, and the effective management of our services to ensure that our company is recognized for our relentless pursuit of improvement and for continually exceeding expectations.

Information Management Group, Inc. has provided continuous IT support to the U.S. Army Intelligence and Security Command (INSCOM) since 1997. IMG provides direct network and systems Operations & Maintenance (O&M) support to ensure connectivity for Army INSCOM, including system maintenance and repair support; system operations support; configuration management support; and Communications Security (COMSEC) and circuit management support.

IMG is hiring a Project Manager with TS/SCI to support our customer in Charlottesville, VA.
Plan, execute, and close projects that meet or exceed customer objectives
Create clear and attainable project objectives, build project requirements, and manage constraints of cost, time, scope, and quality
Develop the overall project plan and manage project operations
Manage the project stakeholders, project team, project risk, project schedule, project budget, and project conflicts
Ensure team members know and execute their respective roles and the roles of the other team members
Ensure production schedules are met and system resources are used effectively
Coordinate resolution of production-related problems
Ensures proper relationships are established between customers, teaming partners, and vendors to facilitate the delivery of information technology services
Project Management Professional (PMP) certification or Federal Acquisition Certification Program/Project Managers (FAC-P/PM) Entry Level certification on Project Management is required.

Clearance Required: TS/SCI

Education and Experience Required:

HS or GED and 10 years experience

Associates and 8 years experience

BS and 6 years experience

MS and 4 years experience

CORE VALUES

PEOPLE. KNOWLEDGE. VISION.

Respect – We value respecting self, respecting others and the world around us.

Integrity – We value following through on our promises to our employees and our customers.

Teamwork – We value the synergy achieved by working together.

Diversity – We value the impact a different perspective brings to a solution.

Learning – We value expanding, refining and increasing our understanding.

Commitment – We value committing to the job at hand.

Ownership – We value taking ownership over the outcomes of our actions.

IMG COMPANY BENEFITS

Health, dental, vision, and life insurance

401(k) with company match

20 days of personal leave plus paid holidays

Certification Reimbursement

Information Management Group is an EOE. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to Minority/Female/Disabled/Veteran/Gender Identity/Sexual Orientation/National Origin

name: State Filing Business Analyst
description:
Ready to make an impact? If so, read on!

GEICO’s State Filing department is seeking candidates for a Business Analyst position that provides an opportunity to learn and explore some of the company's important functions related to filing compliance and rating systems.

Job Duties & Responsibilities:


As a Business Analyst, you will work closely with your team on each project while gaining exposure to many different departments within GEICO including Pricing, Product Management, Reserving, Underwriting, Compliance, and IT.

A typical day includes data analysis, maintenance of GEICO rating systems, testing revisions using GEICO sales/service applications, and corresponding with state insurance departments.

Systems development is a significant portion of the analyst’s responsibilities as GEICO is constantly making changes to our insurance product to maintain a competitive edge in the market place.

Would you like to join this innovative team? If so, do you meet these qualifications?

Candidate Qualifications:
Applicant should have considerable PC experience, good basic math skills, analytical skills, and the ability to solve problems accurately and quickly. It is important to be self-motivated with good organizational skills. Most importantly, the selected candidate must be able to get the job done with a high level of quality. Other important skills needed include the ability to multi-task and function in a fast-paced environment.
Bachelor's degree required
Strong analytical and communication skills
Proficiency with Excel, Access, and Word
Excellent time management
Programming experience is a plus
Commitment to insurance studies is a plus
Please upload a resume and all unofficial transcripts (undergraduate and graduate) when submitting your application for review.

Salary Information:
Entry level starting salary is in the mid to upper $50K range

About GEICO

For more than 75 years, GEICO has stood out from the rest of the insurance industry! We are one of the nation's largest and fastest-growing auto insurers thanks to our low rates, outstanding service and clever marketing. We're an industry leader employing thousands of dedicated and hard-working associates. As a wholly owned subsidiary of Berkshire Hathaway, we offer associates training and career advancement in a financially stable and rewarding workplace.

Our associates' quality of life is important to us. Full-time GEICO associates are offered a comprehensive Total Rewards Program*, including:
401(k) and profit-sharing plans
Medical, dental, vision and life insurance
Paid vacation, holidays and leave programs
Tuition reimbursement
Associate assistance program
Flexible spending accounts
Business casual dress
Fitness and dining facilities (at most locations)
Associate clubs and sports teams
Volunteer opportunities
GEICO Federal Credit Union
Benefit offerings for positions other than full-time may vary.
GEICO is an equal opportunity employer. GEICO conducts drug screens and background checks on applicants who accept employment offers.

How to Apply

Click "Apply for Job" to complete your application. You will need an active email address and phone number. Please upload your resume, preferably as Word .doc files or PDF. Once you begin your application you can save it and access it later. Your application should include any work and/or internship experience from at least the past five years.

name: Project Manager
description:
PLEASE CLICK APPLY OR TEXT "JOBS" TO 561-660-9797 FROM YOUR SMARTPHONE!

The world's leading private security organization, G4S, has an immediate job opportunity for a Project Manager. As a Project Manager, you will oversee and manage the operations and administrative requirements of the G4S client efforts in the Los Angeles Area of Responsibility. This position will ensure contract compliance in accordance with State, Federal, G4S policies and procedures as well as client contract requirements. The Project Manager manages several client locations by assigning directives to a various levels of project supervision and management.

G4S is a security provider for the United States government, fortune 500 companies, nuclear power plants, oil and gas companies, airport, ports, banks, hospitals, factories, warehouses, commercial facilities, residential communities and much more.

G4S offers job security, excellent pay and benefits, and career opportunities. We offer entry level careers, management careers, sales careers and executive careers across the United States and internationally.

Role Responsibility:

Specific Duties and Essential Functions
Coordinate issues to ensure that all programs are in compliance with the Statement of Work, State, Federal and G4S policies and procedures by requiring daily oral summary reports, weekly meetings on operational issues and monthly written status reports
Provide account management and oversight for the recruitment, selection, orientation, training, development and retention of high caliber staff; plans assigns, and directs work; provide performance feedback, coach associates, and ensure disciplinary actions, as necessary; support staff as appropriate in carrying out their respective responsibilities
Review weekly the Profit and Loss (P&L) reports, Overtime Reports and any other fiscal reports to ensure compliance and fiscal responsibility
Maintain monthly communication both by phone and site visits with senior client representatives to ensure customer satisfaction and to minimize contractual performance issues
Review highly complex project developments to include plans, policies and procedures tasked to subordinate managers
Act as the final deciding official on adverse actions proposed and directed by the project subordinate managers when such actions are appealed
Provide as needed operational briefings to the Regional Vice-President
Conducts monthly office visits to sector offices
The Ideal Candidate:

Education, Licenses and Certifications Required
Must be able to meet and maintain any applicable licensing or certification requirements
Must possess one or more of the following:
High school diploma or equivalent with a minimum of 4 years of work experience in a security or law enforcement related field
Bachelor's degree in Criminal Justice or related field
Type and Length of Specific Experience Required
Must have at least five (5) years of administrative and project management experience in the detention and transportation of detainees
Work history must include ach of the following:
Demonstrated knowledge of the principles, concepts, methods, and techniques of transportation operations management
Success in management of a large independent business enterprise or Government Program
Skills Required
Ability to learn, understand, and apply new technologies
Ability to effectively prioritize and execute tasks in a high-pressure environment
Ability to conform to shifting priorities, demands and timelines through analytical and problem-solving capabilities
Proficient computer skills including Microsoft Office
Effective oral and written communication skills
Active listening skills
Ability to assess and evaluate situations effectively
Ability to identify critical issues quickly and accurately
Attention to detail
Other
Must be at least 18 years old or the minimum age required by state, if higher
Must be a U.S. citizen or a foreign citizen authorized to legally work in the United States
Subject to a drug screen to the extent permitted by law
Must be able to provide, upon job offer, a DD214 discharge document with discharge status indicated, if prior military
Physical Requirements and Environment

Environment: Indoor and outdoor, temperature ranges from moderate to extreme cold and heat

Major activity: Working on a PC while sitting, walking, standing, speaking, listening, observing

Physical efforts to carry out job duties: Standing, walking, and sitting. Minimal to no stooping or kneeling.

About the Company:

EOE Minority/Female/Disabled/Veteran/Sexual Orientation/Gender Identity

G4S is an Equal Opportunity/Affirmative Action Employer

and an Alcohol- and Drug-Free Workplace

If you have any questions regarding Equal Employment Opportunity, Affirmative Action or Diversity and Inclusion, or have difficulty using the online system and require an alternate method to apply, please contact our Corporate Human Resources Department at (800) 506-6265.

To receive an update on your application status, please contact our local office by following this link: http://www.g4s.us/en/Contact-Us/Local-Offices

name: Access Control Program Manager
description:
Job Reference: G4S/TP/2985559/135055
Number of Positions: 1
Job Category: Security/Protective Services
Contract Type: Full Time
Salary: $90000 - $95000

Location:
Menlo Park, California
G4S Region:
North America
Country:United States

G4S Business Unit:US Secure Solutions
Closing Date: December 26, 2018

Job Introduction:

PLEASE CLICK APPLY OR TEXT "JOBS" TO 561-660-9797 FROM YOUR SMARTPHONE!

** $2,000 Bonus and $250 Referral Bonus! **

The world's leading private security organization, G4S, has an immediate job opportunity for an Access Control Program Manager. As an Access Control Program Manager, you will be responsible for ensuring implementation and compliance with client physical and electronic access control policy as well as visitor management system. This position oversees and ensures all electronic access is programmed according to employee status to include the visitor management program. This position coordinates with the client, contract companies and employees to investigate, troubleshoot, and oversee access control policies are adhered. This position will act as G4S Secure Solutions liaison on behalf of the client with the customers and employees. This position creates and produces required and requested reports as needed and provides workflow and project assignments to the Program Coordinator.

G4S is a security provider for the United States government, fortune 500 companies, nuclear power plants, oil and gas companies, airport, ports, banks, hospitals, factories, warehouses, commercial facilities, residential communities and much more.

** $2,000 bonus payable after 90 days of continuous employment. $250 referral bonus payable after 30 days of continuous employment. Bonus amount is subject to applicable federal and state income withholdings. **

G4S offers job security, excellent pay and benefits, and career opportunities. We offer entry level careers, management careers, sales careers and executive careers across the United States and internationally.

Role Responsibility:

Specific Duties and Essential Functions
Oversee the utilization and implementation of a variety of computer programs and badge making machines used to protect and safeguard customers property and assets
Develop, implement and maintain access control policy and procedures
Design and implement electronic access control and physical access control elements to ensure the protection and safety of customer employees, assets and brand name
Ensure the team is tracking and maintaining security reports to ensure that all records are up to date and in compliance
Control and drive process improvement to the visitor management program
Manage and lead the team who will research, investigate, and compile information related to access control and visitor management
Communicate compliance requirements to ensure the badging stations are kept abreast of the security access control needs
Determine best course of action to minimize exposure to critical areas using all elements of access control
Oversight on access control and visitor management to client and customers
Manage access control provisioning process for new sites:
Connect with numerous teams (GSST, Bizapps, DC local teams) to understand business requirements and controls
Setup door groups to clearances with GSST
Add new sites and clearances to manage access with Bizapps
Data Center Access Validations
Monitor access validation dashboard and deadlines are met to ensure IA and EY audits are passed.
Leased DC access validations are completed monthly via dropbox, and quarterly via tasks, monitor completion of each leased DC access list validation and follow up as necessary to ensure monthly and quarterly compliance
The Ideal Candidate:

Education, Licenses and Certifications Required
Must possess a high school diploma or equivalent
Pass any State-required training or other qualifications for licensing
Type and Length of Specific Experience Required
Minimum of 2 years of security management experience related to access control and visitor management
Skills Required
Proficient computer skills including Microsoft Office
Effective oral and written communication skills
Active listening skills
Ability to assess and evaluate situations effectively
Ability to identify critical issues quickly and accurately
Attention to detail
Other
Must be at least 18 years old or the minimum age required by the state, if higher
Must be a U.S. citizen or a foreign citizen authorized to legally work in the United States
Must be willing and able to work flexible schedules to include evenings and weekends
Subject to a drug screen to the extent permitted by law
Must be able to provide, upon job offer, a DD214 discharge document with discharge status indicated, if prior military
Physical Requirements and Environment

Environment: Indoor with minimal to no exposure to extreme temperatures

Major activity: Working on a PC while sitting, speaking, listening, observing

Physical efforts to carry out job duties: Sitting, observing, typing. Minimal standing or walking. Little to no reaching, or kneeling.

name: Junior Business Analyst
description:
Entry Level Business Analyst opportunity in Dearborn, Michigan!

Annual salary range $35-37K

The Ford Lincoln Protect (FLP) Junior Business Analyst is the first step in a progression of Business Analyst positions within the FLP program. Each position builds upon the skills and experience obtained in the previous position. We are looking for professional, self-motivated candidates that have excellent analytical and troubleshooting skills; outstanding time management and organizational capabilities; the ability to manage customer expectations and escalations; and those that can identify process improvements and best practices. Excellent written and oral communication skills

name: Program Manager II - Maryland
description:
The Program Manager (PM) serves as the main point of contact with the customer and is responsible for the successful cost, schedule, and performance of the contract.

The selected candidate directly contributes to program efforts in several areas, including cost management/avoidance, schedule estimation and tracking, contract performance management, risk management, requirements analysis, and quality assurance activities. The PM ensures proper performance of tasks necessary to ensure the most efficient and effective execution of the contract.

Clearance Requirements: TS/SCI + Poly
Act as the central focal point and authority for execution of the project
Ensure project and product requirements are established and manage changes
Comprehend, communicate, and manage product & project priorities
Motivate and communicate clear & timely direction to the team
Identify and manage project resources and/or organizational conflicts
Comprehend and improve relevant project development processes and ensure adherence
Maintain objectivity and composure under pressure
Perform variance analyses of schedule and cost on a formal and informal basis and present them to senior management (i.e. earned value management system)
Serve as the primary interface with the customer on all matters involving contract execution
Assure that conduct of contract requirements is executed in accordance with appropriate regulations and Company policies and procedures (i.e.: federal acquisition regulations)
Provide leadership to team. Assures communication and cooperation among team members and resolves areas of conflict
Must possess an active Top Secret Security Clearance with Polygraph (TS/SCI + Poly)
U.S. citizenship REQUIRED
Ten (10) years of experience as a program or project manager in managing programs and contracts of similar scope, type, and complexity is required.
Eight (8) or more years of NSA SIGNINT experience with a minimum of three(3) within the last five (5) years
Two (2) years of experience managing a customer service team within the last five(5) years and working directly with customers
Two (2) years or more experience working with NSA/CSS SIGINT Product Lines.
Knowledgeable of the guidelines provided by the Federal Acquisition Regulation (FAR), Defense Federal Acquisition Regulation Supplement (DFARS)DOD 5000 series and Intelligence Community Directive (ICD) 801 policies
PMP certification, FAC-P/PM Entry Level certification or Defense Acquisition Workforce (Preferred)

name: ENTRY LEVEL MANAGEMENT TRAINEE | PROJECT MANAGER
description:
We train Entry Level applicants in: Project Management, Sales, Marketing and Public Speaking.

CG International in Nashville is looking to kick-start their expansion plans with people that are excited about learning, growing and having fun!

MANAGEMENT TRAINEE OPENINGS INVOLVE TRAINING IN:
SALES AND BUSINESS DEVELOPMENT
CREATING BRAND AWARENESS FOR CLIENTS
INCREASING MARKET SHARE FOR CLIENTS
CUSTOMER SERVICE AND CLIENT RELATIONS
RECRUITMENT, ADMINISTRATION, FINANCE

Rapid advancement is available for top performers looking to take on additional responsibility, but all openings start off at entry-level. The stages of advancement are clearly outlined and are dependent on results, not seniority, experience, education nor office politics. Regional, national and international travel opportunities will also exist for top performers with a desire to learn and grow.

Your initial responsibilities will be public relations, sales, marketing and customer service orientated. You'll then have the chance to learn recruitment and developmental training skills; and you'll begin to build a team. Once you have a productive team, you'll learn the business management and administration techniques.

IF YOU HAVE EVER THOUGHT ABOUT GETTING INTO MANAGEMENT OR BUSINESS, WE'D LOVE TO HEAR FROM YOU!

REQUIREMENTS:
All applicants must be 18+ years of age & eligible to work in the USA
All applicants should be able to commute to Nashville on a daily basis
No sales or management experience is required, but experience in retail sales, customer service, hospitality, sport, teamwork, leadership or similar can be helpful
A degree is not required either, but ambitious graduates with business-related degrees often do well

name: Business Analyst
description:
CentralSquare is a leader in government information technologies, providing a broad range of innovative software solutions to government offices, agencies and utility companies throughout North America. The company's products address the wireless computing requirements of a rapidly changing public sector market and support the end-to-end delivery of e-government access to citizens.

For public safety & justice agencies, CentralSquare solutions offer system-wide integration and interoperability for computer-aided dispatch, records management, mobile computing, and jails management. We are currently seeking a Business Analyst to analyze requirements, studying business functions and gathering information to develop the products that service our communities.

This position reports to the Associate Manager Development or Manager development.

The Business Analyst:
ENTRY LEVEL OPPORTUNITY
Analyses State specifications to derive CentralSquare solutions.
Creates forms for CentralSquare solutions.
Works with customers to understand their needs/requirements and communicates them to the product owner and development teams.
Defines project requirements by identifying project milestones, phases, and elements.
Monitors project progress by tracking activity; resolving problems; publishing progress reports; recommending actions.
Writes and maintains user documentation; providing support; training users.
Prepares technical reports by collecting, analyzing, and summarizing information and trends.
Maintains professional and technical knowledge by attending educational workshops; reviewing professional publications.
Contributes to team effort by accomplishing related results as needed.
Assists customers in the certification process for each state.
Provides assistance in any phase of the Software Development Life Cycle (SDLC).
Exceptional verbal and written communication in English.
Exceptional organizational skills.
A mindset of continuous improvement for both product and process.
Interpersonal skills to facilitate intradepartmental and interdepartmental work relationships.
Promotes and creates collaboration across multiple departments.
Strong business and professional ethics.
Degree courses that apply to this position:
Computer science
MIS (Management Information Systems)
Engineering (any)
Business Administration

name: Project Assisant Intern for Project Manager
description:
Company Profiles

Weir has been in business since 1871 and our sustainability and success has been built on attracting, retaining, and developing exceptional people.

As a global company, employing around 15,000 people in over 70 countries, we reflect the diversity of our customers in the diversity of our people and ensure everyone is given the opportunity to flourish regardless of their gender, race, beliefs or background.

Weir is an inclusive and innovative organisation where you can be your authentic self. We continually develop our talent and diversity of thought to keep our business relevant, innovative and successful for the future.

Enabling our people to unleash their full potential is central to ‘We are Weir’, our vision, mission, and strategic priorities. We aim to be the most admired engineering business in our markets and we'll achieve that ambition by being the employer of choice in our markets.

We offer a wide range of career opportunities across a variety of technical and business roles in engineering, manufacturing and service locations worldwide.

Business Need / Purpose of Role

Reporting to the Project Manager, the Project Assistant is a detail oriented individual capable of multitasking and working within many different disciplines to assist in project management activities. This is an entry level position within the Value Stream.

Objectives & Measurement - Key Responsibilities

Project order entry and maintenance.

Facilitate BOM development and maintenance

Facilitate MO creation/fulfillment and closure

Monitor order flow for potential roadblocks

Expedite both internal and external actions - maintain Smartsheet

Basic customer service such as status updates and requests for information

Work with Supply chain on supplier scope management

Maintenance of project metrics

Proctor meetings and document progress

Work Environment

Complete and maintain all required paperwork, records and documents.

Complete special projects as assigned.

Comply with all Product Marketing Department and Company policies, procedures and programs.

Promote and maintain a flexible, cooperative, team-oriented and customer-focused attitude within and between departments.

Keep the Applications Engineering Supervisor and the Sales Engineering Manager aware of any pertinent issues or concerns.

Nothing in this position description restricts management's right to assign or reassign duties and responsibilities to this job at any time.

Maintain technical competency and remain current in technology.

Responsible for Environmental Health and Safety management and policy commitments as prescribed for this role in Weir's Duty of Care.

Job Knowledge / Education and Qualifications

Education and/or Experience - A Bachelor’s degree in an engineering field is preferred. A comparable technical degree with relevant practical experience would also be considered.

Language Skills - Ability to read and interpret documents such as safety rules, operating and maintenance instructions, and procedure manuals. Ability to write routine reports and correspondence. Ability to speak effectively before groups of customers or employees of the organization.

Mathematical - The ability to work with algebra, geometry and trigonometry, percentages, and fractions is required. Ability to compute rate, ratio, and percent and to draw and interpret bar graphs.

Reasoning Ability - The ability to define problems, collect data, establish facts, draw valid conclusions, interpret technical instructions and deal with several abstract and concrete variables is required.

Other Knowledge, Skills and Abilities

Good Excel and skills are needed with the ability to learn Smartsheet.

The position requires good analytical skills, computer literacy, basic mechanical aptitude and organization abilities; good oral and written communication skills; and strong human relations skills.

The employee must have strong motivation, a good work ethic, the ability to work proactively, the ability to promote and maintain strong relationships, confidence in their own abilities and the capability to act decisively.

The employee must be able to work effectively independently, as a team member; project and maintain professionalism in all situations; accept responsibility and accountability; and work under pressure and in stressful situations.

Certificates, Licenses, Registrations:

Requires a valid driver’s license. Up to 5% travel is required.

Physical Demands:

While performing the duties of this job, the employee is regularly required to sit and use hands to finger, handle and touch objects. The employee is required to talk, hear, reach, stand, or walk. The employee is occasionally required to lift up to ten pounds. Specific vision abilities required by this job include close, distance, and peripheral vision and depth perception.

Work Environment:

The physical demands described here are representative of those that must be met by an employee to successfully perform the essential functions of this job. Reasonable accommodations may be made to enable individuals with disabilities to perform the essential functions.

General office environment. Moderate noise.

Core Competencies

Analytical - Synthesizes complex or diverse information; collects and researches data; uses intuition and experience to complement data; designs work flows and procedures.

Technical Skills - Assesses own strengths and weaknesses; pursues training and development opportunities; strives to continuously build knowledge and skills; shares expertise with others.



Written Communication - Writes clearly and informatively; edits work for spelling and grammar; varies writing style to meet needs; presents numerical data effectively; able to read and interpret written information.



Planning/Organizing - Prioritizes and plans work activities; uses time efficiently.

Professionalism - Approaches others in a tactful manner; reacts well under pressure; treats others with respect and consideration regardless of their status or position; accepts responsibility for own actions; follows through on commitments.

Regional Specific Job Information (if applicable)

.

name: B2B Project Manager - Entry level
description:
Agilent inspires and supports discoveries that advance the quality of life. We provide life science, diagnostic and applied market laboratories worldwide with instruments, services, consumables, applications and expertise. Agilent enables customers to gain the answers and insights they seek ---- so they can do what they do best: improve the world around us. Information about Agilent is available at www.agilent.com.

Eager to start a far-reaching career in a progressive, dynamic environment? This is your opportunity to join our high-achieving team, where you be educated to lead projects to implement and develop tailored "electronic data interchange (EDI)" solutions with Agilent's largest and most important customers. Through so-called "EDI/B2B connections" we receive orders from our customer's electronic procurement (E-Procurement) systems and return order status and invoices in a fully automated electronic way -- thereby making it easier for customers to do business with Agilent and to increase efficiency in transactions on both sites. We also provide electronic product information in the customers desired electronic format. Via so-called "E-Catalogues" and "Punch Outs" we competitively position Agilent's portfolio in the customer's own procurement system. We make it easier for users to find all information needed to initiate a purchase from Agilent and secure Agilent's position as a "preferred supplier".

The Junior B2B project manager role is embedded into our team of B2B project managers in Delaware and will report directly into the global E-Business leader. The owner of the role will interact directly with the "E-Procurement" teams of our most important and strategic customers -- as well as a broad network of internal resources in IT, Customer Service, Sales and Marketing. The team supports B2B globally allowing a great insight into different cultures, processes and regulations around the globe.

Working within the B2B team, you will need to understand business process specifics, assist to determine the scope of work, and insure that both the business requirements and customer specifications are met for assigned project implementations. The standard project management activities such as adhering to timelines, organizing resources, providing clear and concise project plans, and documenting results is required. An understanding of business best practices and a working knowledge of B2B concepts for business is preferred. The Junior Project Manager must have the ability to establish good working relationships within Agilent, our customers and with our external eCommerce partners and be willing to work and learn in the current and future B2B environment.

Supporting "E-Procurement" is an already big, important and constantly growing demand in the life science market. Multiple countries started "E-Government" initiatives to realize the enormous efficiency opportunities from automated purchasing solutions. Revenue growth from electronic sales channels is very high and the B2B team's contribution is vital to increase Agilent's competitiveness in the market. This position provides an excellent opportunity to gain experience and to develop the needed skills to be a successful player in a very dynamic growth market.

Eager to build a far-reaching career in a progressive, dynamic environment? This is your opportunity to join our high-achieving team, where youll work on assignments and develop solutions that develop market/product business plans and strategic marketing programs, while enjoying all the support and encouragement you need to build a far-reaching career.

Skills/Core Competencies:
Bachelor's degree in E-commerce, E-business, MIS, or equivalent education/experience.
Experience in project management, proficiency in Microsoft Project/Excel
Knowledge in Data management, Data transfer, Data mapping, XML, EDI
Experience in E-Procurement solutions a plus -- e.g. SAP, Ariba or SciQuest, "Punch out", eCatalog
Strong analytic and logic skills
Ability to work in and understand complex requirements and processes and business scenarios
Ability to focus on details, organize and follow through
Strong focus on customer satisfaction and service
Able to collaborate effectively in a highly professional environment - respectful and self-aware, self-confident and able to manage conflicts of interest
Excellent communication and documentation skills - both in a business as well a technical environment
Excellent verbal and written English skills
Additional languages especially Chinese or Japanese are a plus.
Motivated self-starter, able to work independently
Able to handle stressful situations - ability to work on multiple projects and tasks at the same time in a challenging environment
Willingness and ability to work across time zones -- respectful to different cultures (International experience or previous travel abroad is a plus.)
Agilent Technologies, Inc. is an Equal Employment Opportunity and Affirmative Action employer. We value diversity at all levels. All individuals, regardless of personal characteristics, are encouraged to apply. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to sex, pregnancy, race, religion or religious creed, color, gender, gender identity, gender expression, national origin, ancestry, physical or mental disability, medical condition, genetic information, marital status, registered domestic partner status, age, sexual orientation, military or veteran status, protected veteran status, or any other basis protected by federal, state, local law, ordinance, or regulation and will not be discriminated against on these bases.

name: Project Manager (Remote OK)
description:
We’re looking for a Project Manager to help SuperHi with the successful planning, design, execution, monitoring and closure of features and new products we're creating.Who are SuperHi?

We make online courses and tools that make learning new skills easier. SuperHi’s mission is to give creative and curious people the tools and techniques to bring ideas and work to life online.

We think that education should be accessible to all, whatever your financial situation; that we won’t know how good technology can be until everyone has equal chance to participate; that diverse backgrounds and experiences working in the creative industries is crucial; that complementing whatever you're good at with new skills is a clear advantage; and that learning should be practical, fun as well as stress-free for the best chance to make it stick.

We think that we should all work harder to ensure skillsets are distributed representatively in the creative and tech industries. We're proud and humbled that our current students are 51% female, 1% non-binary and 48% male from a wide range of backgrounds and nearly eighty countries. They make amazing sites and we also get better learning outcomes because we're online-first.

We’re a proudly remote team with people located in New York, London, Toronto and Dundee.


Job Description

We’re looking for someone to help us make beautiful products for our community to a high quality.

As our project manager you’ll work closely with our team to define, build and grow our proposition for people in the creative and tech industries looking to learn new skills. You’ll have understanding and experience of effective product and project management tools and techniques and how to best implement them in real world scenarios. You’ll be a creative thinker and problem solver that takes ownership who is comfortable operating in an evolving environment.


Responsibilities
Maintaining a cross-functional product roadmap
Managing sprints + prioritization of upcoming tasks
Communicating + delivering to timelines effectively
Document ideas from the community and team into the backlog & icebox
Track results, provide insights and make recommendations
Coach the team and individuals to improve their effectiveness over time
Being open to supporting other areas, such as customer support and community management (we’re a small team so often help outside our core specialisms)

Who you'll work with
Adam Oskwarek, COO — You'll be reporting to Adam who runs the operational side of SuperHi and you'll work closely with him on the implementation of your responsibilities
Rik Lomas, CEO — You'll also work closely with Rik, the founder and CEO, to work out best plans for upcoming products and features that we launch
Requirements
3+ years experience in a product and/or project manager role – this is not an entry level position
Excited to support a global community to learn new skills together, online
Self-motivated & self-managing with exceptional time management skills
Human, supportive people manager that understands how to provide feedback
Excellent analytical skills, detail orientated and prioritization focussed
Experience setting up/managing processes in an evolving environment
Coaching-based approach to team accountability and process management
Understanding of common PM methodologies and frameworks
Comfortable prioritizing/scheduling outputs to optimize delivery in a small team
Strong stakeholder management skills

Desirable
Experience working remotely in a cross functional team
Exposure to a combination of startup and larger environments
An understanding of front-end code, UX, design and digital marketing
We're looking for someone within timezones UTC-7 and UTC+2 so your working hours overlap with our current team members
Benefits
As a remote team, we adhere to a similar style salary system to how Buffer calculate salaries
We offer health, dental and vision insurance for US employees
We offer a stipend to get a workspace local to you if you prefer not to work at home
Paid sick and vacation days
Company provided equipment (laptop, screens, standing desks, etc.)
We are an equal opportunities employer and we welcome anyone of any gender, race, sexuality, ability, background, age, etc. to apply. Diversity and inclusion is very important to SuperHi – our students come from all walks of life and our team should reflect that too.

name: Project Manager Associate
description:
Altair ProductDesign is a global, multi-disciplinary product development consultancy of more than 700 designers, engineers, scientists, and creative thinkers. As a wholly owned subsidiary of Altair Engineering, Inc. (www.altair.com), this cross-functional organization is best known for its leadership in combining human and machine creativity to fuel innovation, automate processes, and develop new methods. Altair ProductDesign firmly advocates a user-centered, team-based design approach, and utilizes proprietary simulation and optimization technologies to help clients bring innovative, profitable products to market faster.

Ensure standard processes and best practices are followed

Facilitate meetings with business partners to resolve issues and review project updates

Primary job functions do not typically require exercising independent judgment

Excel, Powerpoint, Presentation skills, Organizational skills are key

project management/support in Engineering environment: 2 years (Preferred)

name: Project Manager
description:
Local Only Candidates - Resumes must specify the current location of the candidate, all those who do not state current location will not be considered. - AS A REMINDER - Candidates must be local at time of submission, and available for in person interviews within 1 week of the posting close date. Candidates must also be able to start within 2 weeks of an offer being made.

Position will not only be working on IT projects, candidate must be willing to be cross functional and work multiple projects outside of IT.

The person in this position will provide leadership, guidance and recommendations in managing all aspects of a project's life cycle and works with all related areas of the organization to define requirements, deliverables and timeliness. Manages intermediate level projects utilizing the PMI knowledge areas and process groups. They will utilize PMI best practices and tools and integrate the Arizona Management Systems (AMS) to manage the strategic goals of the division. The type of assignments that an Intermediate Project Manager will be assigned versus a Senior or Entry level Project Manager differ by the complexity and interconnectivity of the type of projects they may be assigned and the experience required to manage this type of project. The person in this position is expected to bring their experience and lessons they have learned managing in projects in the past to this role, particularly their risk management skills, communication management skills and stakeholder management skills. The Intermediate Project Manager is expected to anticipate "client" needs and propose solutions for them. This role should possess knowledge of PMI, the PMBOK, and the PMI framework that they are bringing to this role. The Intermediate Project Manager should also continually seek and capitalize upon opportunities to increase customer satisfaction and improve customer relationships. They are expected to develop their own project plans in Microsoft Project and report out on a regular cadence to leadership the project status.
Manages communications and meetings for projects and teams, creates change and problem solves problems independently and is accountable for themselves and their teams. Participates in prioritization meetings with senior leadership to prioritize projects for the team, minimizes exposure and risks across projects, expected to possess expert knowledge in project management to identify opportunities for change and the ability to convey the need for change.
The Intermediate Project Manager may lead other team members on projects or they may directly manage many large scale projects on their own. This person should also work with team members to develop them as leaders while clarifying roles and responsibilities. They should be to develop ways to monitor project areas and progress and take corrective action. They should possess the skills to handle difficult situations tactfully and discretely, and communicate sensitive information effectively.

Major Responsibilities/Essential Functions
Plan & manage multiple middle to large-sized complex projects by utilizing the PMI knowledge areas, best practices & process groups & integrate the AMS to manage the strategic goals of the division. Anticipate "client" needs by clarifying project scope, develop the project plan in Microsoft Project, & propose solutions to their needs; continually seek & capitalize on opportunities to increase/improve customer satisfaction & relationships.
Manages communications & meetings for projects & teams, creates change & problem solve independently; accountable for self & team; participates in prioritization of projects for team; minimizes exposure & risk across projects; possess expert knowledge in project management to identify opportunities for change & the ability to convey the need for change.
Manages & inspires other team members; evokes creative & innovative thinking from team members while helping them bring their ideas to fruition; provide coaching & guidance for team members, SMEs & consultants to remove roadblocks & successfully complete projects on-time and meeting expectations.

LOVE’S COLLEGE INTERN PROGRAM

The Love’s college internship program is frequently referred to as the best in Oklahoma City. This rapidly growing program provides opportunities for students in multiple areas of the business to receive employee level experience, not just busy work. Students also gain valuable knowledge that they can’t get in a classroom; they are guided through proper etiquette of a professional corporate setting. name: Project Manager
description:
We are seeking a talented individual to join our Benton Harbor team as a Project Manager.

Qualifications/Criteria:
Bachelor of Science degree in Engineering or other technical field
Typically five years or more experience in an Industrial environment delivering projects for automation
Maintains active PMP license
Technical Responsibilities:
Demonstrates a detailed knowledge and experience of project execution from conceptual design, detailed design and implementation through startup.
Demonstrates a high level of knowledge of Project Management practice and utilizes best practices and standards following MAVERICK’s Project Complete® Methodology.
Demonstrates strong leadership capabilities to effectively manage projects and teams while meeting business, customers and billability metrics.
Demonstrates strong understanding, application and communication of financial cost tracking, forecasting and budgeting for projects.
May be assigned responsibility for professional development of assigned resources to provide regular performance feedback, identify development needs, support scheduling to maintain utilization and assist administrative manager in completion of annual performance reviews.

Demonstrates a proactive commitment to safety by taking the time to understand risks and completing all required safety training.

Seeks out new responsibilities and stretch opportunities while demonstrating creativity in identifying better means of accomplishing a job.

Demonstrates a willing, can-do attitude by actively participating in teams.

Demonstrates a business acumen that allows for effective utilization of tools and standards to ensure project deliverables are met.
